hdrCore.processing

HDR Core Image Processing Module

This module provides comprehensive image processing capabilities for HDR images, including tone mapping, exposure control, color space transformations, and advanced image editing operations. It implements a flexible processing pipeline architecture that allows for complex image manipulation workflows.

The module includes both individual processing operations and pipeline management through the ProcessPipe system. It supports various color spaces, geometric transformations, and specialized HDR processing techniques.

Classes: - Processing: Abstract base class for all processing operations - tmo_cctf: Tone mapping using color correction transfer functions - exposure: Exposure adjustment and auto-exposure calculation - contrast: Contrast control with gamma-based adjustments - clip: Value clipping for range control - ColorSpaceTransform: Color space conversion operations - resize: Image resizing with anti-aliasing options - Ycurve: Luminance curve adjustments using B-spline interpolation - saturation: Saturation control in LCH color space - colorEditor: Advanced color editing with selection masks - lightnessMask: Lightness-based masking for tone range selection - geometry: Geometric transformations including cropping and rotation - ProcessPipe: Complete processing pipeline management system

Key Features: - HDR-specific tone mapping operators - Advanced color space conversions (sRGB, XYZ, Lab, LCH) - Selective color editing with mask-based controls - Geometric transformations with proper HDR handling - Multi-threaded processing pipeline execution - Auto-exposure and auto-contrast algorithms - B-spline based tone curve adjustments

  20"""
  21HDR Core Image Processing Module
  22
  23This module provides comprehensive image processing capabilities for HDR images,
  24including tone mapping, exposure control, color space transformations, and advanced
  25image editing operations. It implements a flexible processing pipeline architecture
  26that allows for complex image manipulation workflows.
  27
  28The module includes both individual processing operations and pipeline management
  29through the ProcessPipe system. It supports various color spaces, geometric
  30transformations, and specialized HDR processing techniques.
  31
  32Classes:
  33    - Processing: Abstract base class for all processing operations
  34    - tmo_cctf: Tone mapping using color correction transfer functions
  35    - exposure: Exposure adjustment and auto-exposure calculation
  36    - contrast: Contrast control with gamma-based adjustments
  37    - clip: Value clipping for range control
  38    - ColorSpaceTransform: Color space conversion operations
  39    - resize: Image resizing with anti-aliasing options
  40    - Ycurve: Luminance curve adjustments using B-spline interpolation
  41    - saturation: Saturation control in LCH color space
  42    - colorEditor: Advanced color editing with selection masks
  43    - lightnessMask: Lightness-based masking for tone range selection
  44    - geometry: Geometric transformations including cropping and rotation
  45    - ProcessPipe: Complete processing pipeline management system
  46
  47Key Features:
  48    - HDR-specific tone mapping operators
  49    - Advanced color space conversions (sRGB, XYZ, Lab, LCH)
  50    - Selective color editing with mask-based controls
  51    - Geometric transformations with proper HDR handling
  52    - Multi-threaded processing pipeline execution
  53    - Auto-exposure and auto-contrast algorithms
  54    - B-spline based tone curve adjustments
  55"""
  56

  58# --- Import ------------------------------------------------------------------
  59# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------

  79def XYZ_to_sRGB(XYZ,apply_cctf_encoding=True):
  80    """
  81    Convert pixel array from XYZ to sRGB color space.
  82
  83    Args:
  84        XYZ (numpy.ndarray): Array of pixels in XYZ color space
  85        apply_cctf_encoding (bool, optional): Apply sRGB CCTF encoding function (default: True)
  86            
  87    Returns:
  88        numpy.ndarray: Array of pixels in sRGB color space
  89    """
  90    return  colour.XYZ_to_sRGB(XYZ, 
  91                               illuminant=np.array([ 0.3127, 0.329 ]), 
  92                               chromatic_adaptation_transform='CAT02', 
  93                               apply_cctf_encoding=apply_cctf_encoding)
  94  
  95def sRGB_to_XYZ(RGB,apply_cctf_decoding=True):
  96    """
  97    Convert pixel array from sRGB to XYZ color space.
  98
  99    Args:
 100        RGB (numpy.ndarray): Array of pixels in sRGB color space
 101        apply_cctf_decoding (bool, optional): Apply sRGB CCTF decoding function (default: True)
 102            
 103    Returns:
 104        numpy.ndarray: Array of pixels in XYZ color space
 105    """
 106    return colour.sRGB_to_XYZ(RGB, 
 107                              illuminant=np.array([ 0.3127, 0.329 ]), 
 108                              chromatic_adaptation_transform='CAT02', 
 109                              apply_cctf_decoding=apply_cctf_decoding)           
 110
 111def Lab_to_XYZ(Lab):
 112    """
 113    Convert pixel array from Lab to XYZ color space.
 114
 115    Args:
 116        Lab (numpy.ndarray): Array of pixels in Lab color space
 117            
 118    Returns:
 119        numpy.ndarray: Array of pixels in XYZ color space
 120    """
 121    return colour.Lab_to_XYZ(Lab, illuminant=np.array([ 0.3127, 0.329 ]))
 122
 123def XYZ_to_Lab(XYZ):
 124    """
 125    Convert pixel array from XYZ to Lab color space.
 126
 127    Args:
 128        XYZ (numpy.ndarray): Array of pixels in XYZ color space
 129            
 130    Returns:
 131        numpy.ndarray: Array of pixels in Lab color space
 132    """
 133    return colour.XYZ_to_Lab(XYZ, illuminant=np.array([ 0.3127, 0.329 ]))
 134
 135def Lab_to_sRGB(Lab, apply_cctf_encoding=True, clip = False):
 136    """
 137    Convert pixel array from Lab to sRGB color space.
 138
 139    Args:
 140        Lab (numpy.ndarray): Array of pixels in Lab color space
 141        apply_cctf_encoding (bool, optional): Apply sRGB CCTF encoding function (default: True)
 142        clip (bool, optional): Clip values beyond color space limits (default: False)
 143            
 144    Returns:
 145        numpy.ndarray: Array of pixels in sRGB color space
 146    """
 147    XYZ = colour.Lab_to_XYZ(Lab, illuminant=np.array([ 0.3127, 0.329 ]))
 148    RGB =  colour.XYZ_to_sRGB(XYZ,
 149                              illuminant=np.array([ 0.3127, 0.329 ]), 
 150                              chromatic_adaptation_transform='CAT02', 
 151                              apply_cctf_encoding=apply_cctf_encoding)
 152    if clip:
 153        RGB[RGB<0] = 0
 154        RGB[RGB>1] = 1
 155    return RGB
 156
 157def sRGB_to_Lab(RGB, apply_cctf_decoding=True):
 158    """
 159    Convert pixel array from sRGB to Lab color space.
 160
 161    Args:
 162        RGB (numpy.ndarray): Array of pixels in sRGB color space
 163        apply_cctf_decoding (bool, optional): Apply sRGB CCTF decoding function (default: True)
 164            
 165    Returns:
 166        numpy.ndarray: Array of pixels in Lab color space
 167    """
 168    XYZ = colour.sRGB_to_XYZ(RGB, 
 169                             illuminant=np.array([ 0.3127, 0.329 ]), 
 170                             chromatic_adaptation_transform='CAT02', 
 171                             apply_cctf_decoding=apply_cctf_decoding)           
 172    Lab = colour.XYZ_to_Lab(XYZ, illuminant=np.array([ 0.3127, 0.329 ]))
 173    return Lab
 174
 175def Lch_to_sRGB(Lch,apply_cctf_encoding=True, clip=False):
 176    """
 177    Convert pixel array from LCH to sRGB color space.
 178
 179    Args:
 180        Lch (numpy.ndarray): Array of pixels in LCH color space
 181        apply_cctf_encoding (bool, optional): Apply sRGB CCTF encoding function (default: True)
 182        clip (bool, optional): Clip values beyond color space limits (default: False)
 183            
 184    Returns:
 185        numpy.ndarray: Array of pixels in sRGB color space
 186    """
 187    Lab = colour.LCHab_to_Lab(Lch)
 188    XYZ = colour.Lab_to_XYZ(Lab, illuminant=np.array([ 0.3127, 0.329 ]))
 189    RGB = colour.XYZ_to_sRGB(
 190        XYZ, illuminant=np.array([ 0.3127, 0.329 ]), 
 191        chromatic_adaptation_transform='CAT02', 
 192        apply_cctf_encoding = apply_cctf_encoding)
 193    if clip:
 194        RGB[RGB<0] = 0
 195        RGB[RGB>1] = 1
 196    return RGB

 198# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 199# --- Class Processing -------------------------------------------------------
 200# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 201class Processing(object):
 202    """
 203    Base class for HDR image processing operations.
 204
 205    This class defines the common interface for all image processing operations
 206    in the HDR pipeline. It provides the basic structure and common mechanisms
 207    for operation execution.
 208
 209    Interface:
 210    Each processing operation must implement:
 211    - compute() method: Operation execution
 212    - Parameter management: Storage and validation
 213    - Operation state: Change tracking
 214
 215    Features:
 216    - Non-destructive operations
 217    - HDR processing support
 218    - Parameter validation
 219    - State management
 220    - Performance profiling
 221
 222    Usage:
 223        class MyOperation(Processing):
 224            def compute(self, img, **kwargs):
 225                # Operation implementation
 226                return result_image
 227
 228    Notes:
 229        - All operations inherit from this class
 230        - Parameters are validated before execution
 231        - Profiling is automatic if enabled
 232        - State is preserved between executions
 233    """
 234
 235    def compute(self, image, **kwargs):
 236        """Execute the processing operation.
 237
 238        Args:
 239            image (hdrCore.image.Image): Input image to process
 240            **kwargs: Operation-specific parameters
 241
 242        Returns:
 243            hdrCore.image.Image: Resulting processed image
 244
 245        Raises:
 246            NotImplementedError: If method is not implemented
 247            ValueError: If parameters are invalid
 248        """
 249        raise NotImplementedError("compute() method must be implemented")
 250
 251# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 252# --- Class tmo_cctf ---------------------------------------------------------
 253# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 254class tmo_cctf(Processing):
 255    """
 256    Tone mapping operator using Color Correction Transfer Functions (CCTF).
 257    
 258    This class implements tone mapping for HDR images using standard color
 259    correction transfer functions, primarily sRGB gamma encoding. It converts
 260    HDR linear data to display-ready format suitable for standard monitors.
 261    
 262    The operator transforms HDR images from linear space to gamma-corrected
 263    space, effectively creating SDR representations of HDR content.
 264    """
 265
 266    def compute(self,img,**kwargs):
 267        """
 268        Apply CCTF-based tone mapping to HDR images.
 269
 270        Args:
 271            img (hdrCore.image.Image): Input HDR image
 272            **kwargs: Processing parameters
 273                function (str, optional): CCTF function to use (default: 'sRGB')
 274                
 275        Returns:
 276            hdrCore.image.Image: Tone-mapped SDR image with gamma correction applied
 277            
 278        Note:
 279            Only processes HDR images. SDR images are returned unchanged.
 280            The output image type is changed to SDR with non-linear encoding.
 281        """
 282        function = 'sRGB'
 283        if 'function' in kwargs: function = kwargs['function']
 284 
 285        res = copy.deepcopy(img)
 286
 287        # can tone map HDR only 
 288        if (img.type == image.imageType.HDR):
 289
 290            # encode
 291            imgRGBprime = colour.cctf_encoding(res.colorData,function=function)
 292
 293            # update attributes
 294            res.colorData       = imgRGBprime
 295            res.type            = image.imageType.SDR
 296            res.linear          = False
 297            res.scalingFactor   = 1.0
 298            res.colorSpace      = colour.models.RGB_COLOURSPACES[function].copy()
 299
 300        return res
 301# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 302# --- Class exposure ---------------------------------------------------------
 303# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 304class exposure(Processing):
 305    """
 306    Exposure adjustment processing with auto-exposure capabilities.
 307    
 308    This class provides exposure control for HDR images, allowing both manual
 309    exposure adjustments in EV (Exposure Value) stops and automatic exposure
 310    calculation based on histogram analysis.
 311    
 312    The exposure adjustment is performed in linear RGB space and uses standard
 313    photographic exposure calculations (powers of 2).
 314    """
 315    
 316    def compute(self,img,**kwargs):
 317        """
 318        Apply exposure adjustment to the image.
 319
 320        Args:
 321            img (hdrCore.image.Image): Input image
 322            **kwargs: Processing parameters
 323                EV (float, optional): Exposure adjustment in stops (default: 0.0)
 324                
 325        Returns:
 326            hdrCore.image.Image: Image with exposure adjustment applied
 327            
 328        Note:
 329            Exposure adjustment is performed in linear RGB space. Non-linear
 330            images are automatically converted to linear, processed, and
 331            returned in linear space.
 332        """
 333        start= timer()
 334        defaultEV = 0.0
 335        if not kwargs: kwargs = {'EV': defaultEV}  # default value
 336        
 337
 338        if 'EV' in kwargs : EV = kwargs['EV']
 339        else:               EV = defaultEV
 340 
 341        res = copy.deepcopy(img)
 342
 343        if EV != defaultEV:
 344            # exposure is done in linear RGB
 345            if not res.linear:
 346                
 347                if pref.computation == 'python':
 348                    start = timer()
 349                    res.colorData =     colour.cctf_decoding(res.colorData, function='sRGB')
 350                    res.linear =        True
 351
 352                elif pref.computation == 'numba':
 353                    start = timer()
 354                    res.colorData =     numbafun.numba_cctf_sRGB_decoding(res.colorData) # encode to prime
 355                    res.linear =        True
 356
 357                elif pref.computation == 'cuda':
 358                    start = timer()
 359                    res.colorData =     numbafun.cuda_cctf_sRGB_decoding(res.colorData) # encode to prime
 360                    res.linear =        True
 361
 362                dt = timer() - start
 363
 364            res.colorData =     res.colorData*math.pow(2,EV)
 365
 366        end = timer()
 367        if pref.verbose: print (" [PROCESS-PROFILING](",end - start,") >> exposure(",img.name,"):", kwargs)
 368
 369        return res
 370
 371    def auto(self,img):
 372        """
 373        Calculate optimal exposure using histogram analysis.
 374        
 375        This method analyzes the image histogram to determine the optimal
 376        exposure value that maximizes the use of the available dynamic range
 377        while avoiding overexposure.
 378
 379        Args:
 380            img (hdrCore.image.Image): Input image for analysis
 381                
 382        Returns:
 383            dict: Dictionary containing the optimal exposure value
 384                  {'EV': optimal_exposure_value}
 385                  
 386        Note:
 387            Uses multi-threaded histogram analysis across multiple exposure
 388            values to find the exposure that maximizes histogram spread
 389            without clipping highlights.
 390        """
 391        minEV, maxEV, step =  -10,10,0.25
 392        evs = np.linspace(minEV,maxEV,num=int((maxEV-minEV)/step)+1)
 393
 394        rgb = copy.deepcopy(img.colorData)
 395        nbPix = rgb.shape[0]*rgb.shape[1]
 396
 397        if not img.linear:  rgbLinear = colour.cctf_decoding(rgb,function='sRGB')
 398        else:               rgbLinear = rgb
 399
 400        bins = np.linspace(0,1,25+1)
 401
 402        # local method for pool (not static!)
 403        def evEval(ev):
 404            """
 405            Evaluate exposure value by histogram analysis.
 406
 407            Args:
 408                ev (float): Exposure value to evaluate
 409                    
 410            Returns:
 411                float: Quality metric for this exposure value
 412            """
 413            rgb_ev = rgbLinear*math.pow(2,ev)
 414            rgb_ev_prime = colour.cctf_encoding(rgb_ev,function='sRGB')
 415            rgb_ev_prime[rgb_ev_prime>1] = 1
 416            XYZ = colour.sRGB_to_XYZ(rgb_ev_prime, apply_cctf_decoding=False)
 417            Y = utils.ndarray2vector(XYZ)[:,1]
 418            nphist_ev_prime, npedges = np.histogram(Y, bins)
 419            nphist_ev_prime = nphist_ev_prime/nbPix
 420            sumH = np.cumsum(nphist_ev_prime[1:-1])[-1]
 421
 422            return sumH
 423
 424        _pool = pathos.multiprocessing.ProcessPool()
 425        results = _pool.map( evEval, evs)
 426        sumsH  = list(results)
 427        
 428        bestEV = evs[np.argmax(sumsH)]
 429        if pref.verbose: print('  [PROCESS] >> exposure.auto(',img.name,'):BEST EV:',bestEV)
 430      
 431        return {'EV':bestEV}
 432# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 433# --- Class contrast ---------------------------------------------------------
 434# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 435class contrast(Processing):
 436    """
 437    Contrast adjustment processing with gamma-based scaling.
 438    
 439    This class provides contrast control by scaling pixel values around a
 440    midpoint using a configurable scaling factor. The contrast adjustment
 441    is performed in gamma-corrected space for perceptually uniform results.
 442    
 443    Positive contrast values increase contrast, while negative values decrease
 444    contrast. The scaling is applied around the 0.5 midpoint value.
 445    """
 446    
 447    def compute(self,img,**kwargs):
 448        """
 449        Apply contrast adjustment to the image.
 450
 451        Args:
 452            img (hdrCore.image.Image): Input image
 453            **kwargs: Processing parameters
 454                contrast (float, optional): Contrast adjustment value (default: 0)
 455                                          Range typically -100 to +100
 456
 457        Returns:
 458            hdrCore.image.Image: Image with contrast adjustment applied
 459            
 460        Note:
 461            Contrast adjustment is performed in gamma-corrected space.
 462            Linear images are automatically converted to gamma space,
 463            processed, and returned in gamma space.
 464        """
 465        start = timer()
 466        defaultContrast =   0.0
 467        maxContrastFactor = 2.0     ###### 5.0
 468        if not kwargs: kwargs = { "contrast": defaultContrast }  # default value 
 469
 470
 471        if 'contrast' in kwargs :   contrastValue = kwargs['contrast']
 472        else:                       contrastValue = defaultContrast
 473
 474        res = copy.deepcopy(img)
 475
 476        if contrastValue != defaultContrast:
 477            # contrast scaling is computed in prime colorspace
 478            if img.linear: 
 479                if pref.computation == 'python':
 480                    start = timer()
 481                    res.colorData =     colour.cctf_encoding(res.colorData, function='sRGB') # encode to prime
 482                    res.linear =        False
 483
 484                elif pref.computation == 'numba':
 485                    start = timer()
 486                    res.colorData =     numbafun.numba_cctf_sRGB_encoding(res.colorData) # encode to prime
 487                    res.linear =        False
 488
 489                elif pref.computation == 'cuda':
 490                    start = timer()
 491                    res.colorData =     numbafun.cuda_cctf_sRGB_encoding(res.colorData) # encode to prime
 492                    res.linear =        False
 493
 494                dt = timer() - start
 495
 496            # scaling contrast
 497            contrastValue = contrastValue/100 
 498            if contrastValue>=0.0:
 499                scalingFactor = 1*(1-contrastValue)+maxContrastFactor*contrastValue
 500            else:
 501                contrastValue = -contrastValue
 502                scalingFactor = 1*(1-contrastValue)+maxContrastFactor*contrastValue
 503                scalingFactor = 1/scalingFactor
 504
 505            res.colorData = scalingFactor*(res.colorData-0.5)+0.5
 506        
 507        end=timer()    
 508        if pref.verbose: print(" [PROCESS-PROFILING] (",end-start,")>> contrast(",img.name,"):", kwargs)
 509
 510        return res
 511# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 512# --- Class clip -------------------------------------------------------------
 513# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 514class clip(Processing):
 515    """
 516    Value clipping processing for range control.
 517    
 518    This class provides hard clipping of pixel values to specified minimum
 519    and maximum bounds. It's commonly used to ensure pixel values remain
 520    within valid ranges after processing operations.
 521    
 522    The clipping operation is applied uniformly across all color channels
 523    and is performed in the current color space of the image.
 524    """
 525
 526    def compute(self,img,**kwargs):
 527        """
 528        Clip image pixel values to specified range.
 529
 530        Args:
 531            img (hdrCore.image.Image): Input image
 532            **kwargs: Processing parameters
 533                min (float, optional): Minimum clipping value (default: 0.0)
 534                max (float, optional): Maximum clipping value (default: 1.0)
 535                
 536        Returns:
 537            hdrCore.image.Image: Image with values clipped to specified range
 538        """ 
 539
 540        min, max = 0.0, 1.0
 541        if 'min' in kwargs: min = kwargs['min']
 542        if 'max' in kwargs: max = kwargs['max']
 543        
 544        res = copy.deepcopy(img)
 545        res.colorData[res.colorData>max] = max
 546        res.colorData[res.colorData<min] = min
 547
 548        return res
 549# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 550# --- Class ColorSpaceTransform ----------------------------------------------
 551# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 552class ColorSpaceTransform(Processing):
 553    """
 554    Color space transformation processing for HDR imaging.
 555    
 556    This class provides comprehensive color space conversions between sRGB,
 557    XYZ, Lab, and other color spaces. It handles proper gamma correction
 558    and maintains HDR/SDR image type compatibility during transformations.
 559    
 560    The transformations are performed using standard illuminants and
 561    chromatic adaptation transforms for accurate color reproduction.
 562    """
 563
 564    def compute(self,img,**kwargs):
 565        """
 566        Transform image between color spaces.
 567
 568        Args:
 569            img (hdrCore.image.Image): Input image
 570            **kwargs: Processing parameters
 571                dest (str): Destination color space ('Lab', 'sRGB', 'XYZ')
 572                
 573        Returns:
 574            hdrCore.image.Image: Image transformed to destination color space
 575            
 576        Note:
 577            Supports conversions between sRGB, XYZ, and Lab color spaces.
 578            Automatically handles gamma correction based on image type and
 579            maintains proper linear/non-linear encoding.
 580        """ 
 581        # first create a copy
 582        res = copy.deepcopy(img)
 583        if not kwargs: print("WARNING[Processing.ColorSpaceTransform(",img.name,"):", "no destination colour space >> return a copy of image]")
 584        else:
 585            if not 'dest'in kwargs: print("WARNING[Processing.ColorSpaceTransform(",img.name,"):", "no 'dest' colour space >> return a copy of image]")
 586            else: # -> 'colorSpace' found
 587                if  kwargs['dest'] == 'Lab': # DEST: Lab
 588                    currentCS = img.colorSpace.name
 589                    # sRGB to Lab
 590                    if currentCS=="sRGB": # sRGB -> Lab
 591                        apply_cctf_decoding=True if not img.linear else False
 592                        
 593                        RGB = res.colorData
 594                        XYZ = colour.sRGB_to_XYZ(RGB, illuminant=np.array([ 0.3127, 0.329 ]), chromatic_adaptation_transform='CAT02', apply_cctf_decoding=apply_cctf_decoding)           
 595                        Lab = colour.XYZ_to_Lab(XYZ, illuminant=np.array([ 0.3127, 0.329 ]))
 596                        res.colorData, res.linear, res.colorSpace  = Lab, None,image.ColorSpace.Lab()
 597
 598                    elif currentCS=="XYZ": # XYZ -> Lab 
 599                        XYZ = res.colorData
 600                        Lab = colour.XYZ_to_Lab(XYZ, illuminant=np.array([ 0.3127, 0.329 ]))
 601                        res.colorData, res.linear,  = Lab, None, image.ColorSpace.XYZ()
 602                              
 603                    elif currentCS == "Lab": # Lab -> Lab                       
 604                        pass # return a copy
 605
 606                elif kwargs['dest'] == 'sRGB': # DEST: sRGB
 607                    currentCS = img.colorSpace.name
 608                    if currentCS=="Lab":  # Lab -> sRGB                                                               
 609                        Lab = res.colorData
 610                        XYZ = colour.Lab_to_XYZ(Lab, illuminant=np.array([ 0.3127, 0.329 ]))
 611                        apply_cctf_encoding = False if img.type == image.imageType.HDR  else  True
 612                        sRGB = colour.colour.XYZ_to_sRGB(XYZ, illuminant=np.array([ 0.3127, 0.329 ]), chromatic_adaptation_transform='CAT02', apply_cctf_encoding=apply_cctf_encoding)
 613                        res.colorData, res.colorSpace, res.linear = sRGB, image.ColorSpace.sRGB(), not apply_cctf_encoding
 614                    
 615                    elif currentCS == "XYZ":# XYZ -> sRGB 
 616                        XYZ = res.colorData
 617                        apply_cctf_encoding = False if (img.type == image.imageType.HDR)  else True
 618                        sRGB = colour.colour.XYZ_to_sRGB(XYZ, illuminant=np.array([ 0.3127, 0.329 ]), chromatic_adaptation_transform='CAT02', apply_cctf_encoding=apply_cctf_encoding)
 619                        res.colorData, res.colorSpace, res.linear = sRGB, image.ColorSpace.sRGB(), not apply_cctf_encoding
 620    
 621                    elif currentCS == "sRGB": # sRGB -> sRGB
 622                        pass # return a copy             
 623                    else:
 624                        print("WARNING[Processing.ColorSpaceTransform(",img.name,"):", "'dest' colour space:",kwargs['dest'] , "not yet implemented !]")
 625
 626                elif kwargs['dest'] == 'XYZ': # DEST: XYZ
 627                    currentCS = img.colorSpace.name
 628                    if currentCS=="sRGB": # sRGB to XYZ                                                         
 629                        apply_cctf_decoding=True if  (img.type == image.imageType.SDR) and (not img.linear) else False
 630                        RGB = res.colorData
 631                        XYZ = colour.sRGB_to_XYZ(RGB, illuminant=np.array([ 0.3127, 0.329 ]), chromatic_adaptation_transform='CAT02', apply_cctf_decoding=apply_cctf_decoding)           
 632                        res.colorData,res.linear , res.colorSpace = XYZ, True, image.ColorSpace.XYZ()
 633                        
 634                    elif currentCS=="XYZ": # XYZ to XYZ                                                         
 635                         pass # return a copy
 636                    
 637                    elif currentCS == "Lab": # Lab to XYZ
 638                        Lab = res.colorData
 639                        XYZ = colour.Lab_to_XYZ(Lab, illuminant=np.array([ 0.3127, 0.329 ]))
 640                        res.colorData, res.linear, res.colorSpace = XYZ, True, image.ColorSpace.buildXYZ()
 641
 642        return res
 643# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 644# --- Class resize -----------------------------------------------------------
 645# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 646class resize(Processing):
 647    """
 648    Image resizing processing with anti-aliasing support.
 649    
 650    This class provides image resizing capabilities while maintaining aspect
 651    ratio or allowing arbitrary scaling. It includes anti-aliasing options
 652    to prevent artifacts during resizing operations.
 653    
 654    The resizing can be constrained to width, height, or both dimensions
 655    with automatic aspect ratio calculation when only one dimension is specified.
 656    """
 657    
 658    def compute(self,img, size=(None,None),anti_aliasing=False):
 659        """
 660        Resize the image to specified dimensions.
 661
 662        Args:
 663            img (hdrCore.image.Image): Input image
 664            size (tuple, optional): Target size as (height, width) (default: (None, None))
 665                                   None values trigger aspect ratio preservation
 666            anti_aliasing (bool, optional): Enable anti-aliasing during resize (default: False)
 667                
 668        Returns:
 669            hdrCore.image.Image: Resized image with updated dimensions
 670            
 671        Note:
 672            - If only width specified: height calculated to preserve aspect ratio
 673            - If only height specified: width calculated to preserve aspect ratio  
 674            - If both None: defaults to height=400 with preserved aspect ratio
 675        """
 676        res = copy.deepcopy(img)
 677        y, x, c =  tuple(res.colorData.shape)
 678        ny,nx = size
 679        if nx and (not ny): 
 680            factor = nx/x
 681            res.colorData = skimage.transform.resize(res.colorData, (int(y * factor),nx ), anti_aliasing)
 682            res.shape = res.colorData.shape
 683        elif (not nx) and ny:
 684            factor = ny/y
 685            res.colorData = skimage.transform.resize(res.colorData, (ny,int(x * factor)), anti_aliasing)
 686            res.shape = res.colorData.shape
 687        elif nx and ny:
 688            res.colorData = skimage.transform.resize(res.colorData, (ny,nx), anti_aliasing)
 689            res.shape = res.colorData.shape
 690        elif (not nx) and (not ny):
 691            ny=400
 692            factor = ny/y
 693            res.colorData = skimage.transform.resize(res.colorData, (ny,int(x * factor)), anti_aliasing)
 694            res.shape = res.colorData.shape
 695        return res
 696# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 697# --- Class Ycurve -----------------------------------------------------------
 698# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 699class Ycurve(Processing):
 700    
 701    def compute(self,img,**kwargs):
 702        """
 703        compute: compute Ycurve according to parameters.
 704
 705        Args:
 706            img (hdrCore.image.Image, Required): image
 707            kwargs (dict,Optionnal): parameters gieven as dict
 708                
 709        Returns:
 710            (hdrCore.image.Image, Required): image
 711                result of Ycurve processing
 712        """ 
 713        start =  timer()
 714        defaultControlPoints = {'start':[0,0], 
 715                                'shadows': [10,10], 
 716                                'blacks': [30,30], 
 717                                'mediums': [50,50], 
 718                                'whites': [70,70], 
 719                                'highlights': [90,90], 
 720                                'end': [100,100]}
 721
 722        if not kwargs: kwargs = defaultControlPoints  # default value 
 723
 724
 725        # results image
 726        res = copy.deepcopy(img)
 727
 728        if kwargs != defaultControlPoints:
 729
 730            if img.linear: 
 731                if pref.computation == 'python':
 732                    start = timer()
 733                    res.colorData =     colour.cctf_encoding(res.colorData, function='sRGB') # encode to prime
 734                    res.linear =        False
 735
 736                elif pref.computation == 'numba':
 737                    start = timer()
 738                    res.colorData =     numbafun.numba_cctf_sRGB_encoding(res.colorData) # encode to prime
 739                    res.linear =        False
 740
 741                elif pref.computation == 'cuda':
 742                    start = timer()
 743                    res.colorData =     numbafun.cuda_cctf_sRGB_encoding(res.colorData) # encode to prime
 744                    res.linear =        False
 745
 746                dt = timer() - start
 747
 748            colorDataY =    sRGB_to_XYZ(res.colorData, apply_cctf_decoding=False)[:,:,1] 
 749            # change for multi-threading computation
 750            # Ymax =          np.amax(colorDataY)*100
 751            # extendedEnd =   [Ymax, kwargs['end'][1]]
 752            extendedEnd =   [200, kwargs['end'][1]]
 753
 754            # create curve adn get y-curve
 755            curve =         BSpline.Curve()
 756            curve.degree =  2
 757            points =        None
 758            curve.ctrlpts =     copy.deepcopy([kwargs['start'], kwargs['shadows'], kwargs['blacks'],  kwargs['mediums'], kwargs['whites'], kwargs['highlights'], extendedEnd])
 759            curve.knotvector =  utilities.generate_knot_vector(curve.degree, len(curve.ctrlpts))
 760            # evaluate curve and get points
 761            points = np.asarray(curve.evalpts)/100
 762            Y = points[:,0]
 763            FY = points[:,1]
 764
 765            # check validity: same shape
 766            if Y.shape == FY.shape:
 767                colorDataFY = np.interp(colorDataY, Y,FY)
 768
 769                # remove zeros
 770                Ymin = np.amin(colorDataY[colorDataY>0])
 771                colorDataY[colorDataY==0] = Ymin
 772
 773                # transform colorData
 774                res.colorData[:,:,0] = res.colorData[:,:,0]*colorDataFY/colorDataY
 775                res.colorData[:,:,1] = res.colorData[:,:,1]*colorDataFY/colorDataY
 776                res.colorData[:,:,2] = res.colorData[:,:,2]*colorDataFY/colorDataY
 777        
 778        end = timer()        
 779        if pref.verbose: print(" [PROCESS-PROFILING] (",end - start,")>> Ycurve(",img.name,"):", kwargs)
 780
 781        return res

 783# --- Class saturation -------------------------------------------------------
 784# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 785class saturation(Processing):
 786    
 787    def compute(self,img,**kwargs):
 788        """saturation operator
 789
 790        Args:
 791            img (hdrCore.image.Image,Required):  input image
 792            kwargs (dict, Optionnal) : parameters
 793                'saturation': float
 794                'method': str
 795                    'method' parameter must be gamma 
 796                default value: {'saturation': 0.0, 'method': 'gamma'}
 797                
 798        Returns:
 799            (hdrCore.image.Image): output image
 800        """ 
 801        start=timer()
 802        defaultValue= {'saturation': 0.0, 'method': 'gamma'}
 803
 804        if not kwargs: kwargs = defaultValue  # default value 
 805
 806
 807        # results image
 808        res = copy.deepcopy(img)
 809
 810        value = kwargs["saturation"]
 811        if value != defaultValue['saturation']:
 812
 813            # go to Lab then Lch
 814            if img.linear: 
 815                colorLab = sRGB_to_Lab(res.colorData, apply_cctf_decoding=False)
 816            else:
 817                colorLab = sRGB_to_Lab(res.colorData, apply_cctf_decoding=True)
 818            colorLCH = colour.Lab_to_LCHab(colorLab)
 819
 820            # saturation in Lch (chroma as saturation)
 821            gamma = 1/((value/25)+1) if value >= 0 else (-value/25)+1
 822            colorLCH[:,:,1] =np.power(colorLCH[:,:,1]/100, gamma)*100
 823
 824
 825            #colorRGB_sat = Lab_to_sRGB(colour.LCHab_to_Lab(colorLCH), apply_cctf_encoding=True)
 826            #res.colorData = colorRGB_sat
 827            #res.linear = False
 828            res.colorData = colorLCH
 829            res.linear = False
 830            res.colorSpace = image.ColorSpace.build('Lch')
 831
 832
 833        end = timer()
 834        if pref.verbose: print(" [PROCESS-PROFILING] (",end - start,")>> saturation(",img.name,"):", kwargs)
 835
 836        return res
 837# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 838# --- Class colorEditor ------------------------------------------------------
 839# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 840class colorEditor(Processing):
 841    """
 842    TODO - Documentation de la classe colorEditor
 843    """
 844    
 845    def compute(self,img, **kwargs):
 846        """color editor operator
 847
 848        Args:
 849            img (hdrCore.image.Image, Required): input image
 850            kwargs (dict, Optionnal): parameters
 851                default value= { 'selection': {'lightness': (0,100),'chroma': (0,100),'hue':(0,360)}, 
 852                                'tolerance': 0.1,
 853                                'edit': {'hue':0.0,'exposure':0.0,'contrast':0.0,'saturation':0.0}, 
 854                                'mask': False}                
 855                
 856        Returns:
 857            (hdrCore.image.Image): output image
 858                
 859        """
 860        start = timer()
 861        defaultValue= {'selection': {'lightness': (0,100),'chroma': (0,100),'hue':(0,360)}, 
 862                       'tolerance': 0.1,
 863                       'edit': {'hue':0.0,'exposure':0.0,'contrast':0.0,'saturation':0.0}, 
 864                       'mask': False}
 865
 866        if not kwargs: kwargs = defaultValue  # default value
 867        if not ('selection' in kwargs): kwargs['selection'] =   defaultValue['selection']
 868        if not ('tolerance' in kwargs): kwargs['tolerance'] =   defaultValue['tolerance']
 869        if not ('edit' in kwargs):      kwargs['edit'] =        defaultValue['edit']
 870        if not ('mask' in kwargs):      kwargs['mask'] =         defaultValue['mask']
 871
 872
 873        # results image
 874        res = copy.deepcopy(img)
 875
 876        # computing
 877        if kwargs != defaultValue:
 878            colorRGB = None
 879            if res.colorSpace.name == 'Lch':
 880                colorLCH = res.colorData
 881            elif res.colorSpace.name == 'sRGB':
 882
 883                covnStart = timer()
 884                if res.linear: 
 885
 886                    colorLab = sRGB_to_Lab(res.colorData, apply_cctf_decoding=False)
 887                    colorLCH = colour.Lab_to_LCHab(colorLab)
 888
 889                else:
 890
 891                    colorLab = sRGB_to_Lab(res.colorData, apply_cctf_decoding=True)
 892                    colorLCH = colour.Lab_to_LCHab(colorLab)
 893                covnEnd = timer()
 894
 895            # selection from colorLCH
 896            colorDataHue =          copy.deepcopy(colorLCH[:,:,2])
 897            colorDataChroma =       copy.deepcopy(colorLCH[:,:,1])
 898            colorDataLightness =    copy.deepcopy(colorLCH[:,:,0])
 899
 900            # selection mask
 901            hMin, hMax = kwargs['selection']['hue'] if 'hue' in kwargs['selection'].keys() else defaultValue['selection']['hue']
 902            cMin, cMax = kwargs['selection']['chroma'] if 'chroma' in kwargs['selection'].keys() else defaultValue['selection']['chroma']
 903            lMin, lMax = kwargs['selection']['lightness']if 'hue' in kwargs['selection'].keys() else defaultValue['selection']['lightness']
 904            # take into account Chroma, Lightness range
 905            cMax = cMax*max(100.0,np.amax(colorDataChroma))/100.0
 906            lMax = lMax*max(100.0,np.amax(colorDataLightness))/100.0
 907
 908            # tolerance
 909            hueTolerance = kwargs['tolerance']*360      # hue range ~ 360
 910            chromaTolerance = kwargs['tolerance']*100   # chroma range ~ 100
 911            lightTolerance = kwargs['tolerance']*100    # lightness range ~ 100
 912
 913
 914            maskStart = timer()
 915
 916            lightnessMask =     utils.NPlinearWeightMask(colorDataLightness, lMin, lMax, lightTolerance)
 917            chromaMask =        utils.NPlinearWeightMask(colorDataChroma, cMin, cMax, chromaTolerance)
 918            hueMask =           utils.NPlinearWeightMask(colorDataHue, hMin, hMax, hueTolerance)
 919
 920            maskEnd = timer()
 921
 922            mask = np.minimum(lightnessMask, np.minimum(chromaMask,hueMask))
 923            compMask = 1.0 - mask
 924            # hueShift (in Lch)
 925            hueShift =  kwargs['edit']['hue']  if 'hue' in kwargs['edit'].keys() else defaultValue['edit']['hue']
 926            if hueShift != 0.0:
 927                colorLCH[:,:,2] = ((colorLCH[:,:,2]+hueShift)%360)*mask + colorLCH[:,:,2]*compMask
 928
 929            # saturation (in Lch)
 930            saturation = kwargs['edit']['saturation'] if 'saturation' in kwargs['edit'].keys() else defaultValue['edit']['saturation']
 931            if saturation != 0 :
 932                gamma = 1/((saturation/25)+1) if saturation >= 0 else (-saturation/25)+1
 933                colorLCH[:,:,1] =np.power(colorLCH[:,:,1]/100, gamma)*100*mask + colorLCH[:,:,1]*compMask
 934
 935            # exposure (in RGB)
 936            ev =  kwargs['edit']['exposure'] if 'exposure' in kwargs['edit'].keys() else defaultValue['edit']['exposure']
 937            if ev != 0.0 :
 938                colorRGB = Lch_to_sRGB(colorLCH,apply_cctf_encoding=False, clip=False)
 939                colorRGBev = copy.deepcopy(colorRGB*math.pow(2,ev))
 940                colorRGBev[:,:,0] = colorRGBev[:,:,0]*mask
 941                colorRGBev[:,:,1] = colorRGBev[:,:,1]*mask
 942                colorRGBev[:,:,2] = colorRGBev[:,:,2]*mask
 943
 944                colorRGB[:,:,0] = colorRGB[:,:,0]*compMask
 945                colorRGB[:,:,1] = colorRGB[:,:,1]*compMask
 946                colorRGB[:,:,2] = colorRGB[:,:,2]*compMask
 947                colorRGB = colorRGB + colorRGBev
 948
 949            # contrast (in RGB prime)
 950            con =  kwargs['edit']['contrast'] if 'exposure' in kwargs['edit'].keys() else defaultValue['edit']['contrast']
 951            if con != 0 :
 952                con = con/100
 953                maxContrastFactor = 2.0
 954                if con>=0.0:
 955                    scalingFactor = 1*(1-con)+maxContrastFactor*con
 956                else:
 957                    con = -con
 958                    scalingFactor = 1*(1-con)+maxContrastFactor*con
 959                    scalingFactor = 1/scalingFactor
 960
 961                pivot = math.pow(2,ev)*(lMin+lMax)/2/100
 962
 963                if not isinstance(colorRGB, np.ndarray):    colorRGB = Lch_to_sRGB(colorLCH,apply_cctf_encoding=True, clip=False)
 964                else :                                      colorRGB = colour.cctf_encoding(colorRGB, function='sRGB')
 965                
 966                colorRGBcon = (colorRGB-pivot)*scalingFactor+pivot
 967
 968                colorRGB[:,:,0] = colorRGBcon[:,:,0]*mask+ colorRGB[:,:,0]*compMask
 969                colorRGB[:,:,1] = colorRGBcon[:,:,1]*mask+ colorRGB[:,:,1]*compMask
 970                colorRGB[:,:,2] = colorRGBcon[:,:,2]*mask+ colorRGB[:,:,2]*compMask
 971
 972                colorRGB = colour.cctf_decoding(colorRGB, function='sRGB')
 973
 974            # final step
 975            if not isinstance(colorRGB, np.ndarray): colorRGB = Lch_to_sRGB(colorLCH,apply_cctf_encoding=False, clip=False)
 976            res.colorData = colorRGB
 977            res.colorSpace = image.ColorSpace.build('sRGB')
 978            res.linear = True
 979
 980        else:
 981            if res.colorSpace.name == 'Lch':
 982                colorLCH = res.colorData
 983                # return to RGB (linear)
 984                colorRGB = Lch_to_sRGB(colorLCH,apply_cctf_encoding=False, clip=False)
 985                res.colorData = colorRGB
 986                res.colorSpace = image.ColorSpace.build('sRGB')
 987                res.linear = True
 988
 989        showMask = kwargs['mask']
 990        if showMask:
 991            res.colorData[:,:,0] = copy.deepcopy(mask)
 992            res.colorData[:,:,1] = copy.deepcopy(mask)
 993            res.colorData[:,:,2] = copy.deepcopy(mask)
 994
 995            res.colorSpace = image.ColorSpace.build('sRGB')
 996            res.linear = False
 997
 998        end = timer()
 999        if pref.verbose: print(" [PROCESS-PROFILING](",end - start,") >> colorEditor(",img.name,"):", kwargs)
1000
1001        return res

1003# --- Class lightnessMask ----------------------------------------------------
1004# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1005class lightnessMask(Processing):
1006    """
1007    TODO - Documentation de la classe lightnessMask
1008    """
1009    
1010    def compute(self, img, **kwargs):
1011        """
1012        Lightness Mask operator.
1013
1014        Args:
1015            img: hdrCore.image.Image
1016                Required  : hdr image
1017            kwargs: dict
1018                Optionnal : parameters
1019                TODO
1020                
1021        Returns:
1022            TODO
1023                TODO
1024        """
1025        start = timer()
1026        defaultMask = { 'shadows': False, 'blacks': False, 'mediums': False, 'whites': False, 'highlights': False}
1027        rangeMask = {   'shadows': [0,20], 
1028                         'blacks': [20,40], 
1029                         'mediums': [40,60], 
1030                         'whites': [60,80], 
1031                         'highlights': [80,100]}
1032        maskColor = {'shadows': [0,0,1], 
1033                     'blacks': [0,1,1], 
1034                     'mediums': [0,1,0], 
1035                     'whites': [1,1,0], 
1036                     'highlights': [1,0,0]}
1037        if not kwargs: kwargs = defaultMask  # default value 
1038
1039        # results image

1041

1043
1044            if img.linear: 
1045                res.colorData = colour.cctf_encoding(res.colorData, function='sRGB') # encode to prime   
1046                res.linear = False
1047
1048            colorDataY = sRGB_to_XYZ(res.colorData, apply_cctf_decoding=False)[:,:,1]
1049            mask = copy.deepcopy(res.colorData)
1050
1051            for key in rangeMask.keys():
1052                if kwargs[key]: # mask on
1053                    mask[(colorDataY >= rangeMask[key][0]/100)*(colorDataY<rangeMask[key][1]/100),:] = np.asarray(maskColor[key])
1054
1055            res.colorData = mask
1056        
1057        end = timer()
1058        if pref.verbose: print(" [PROCESS-PROFILING](",end - start,") >> lightnessMask(",res.name,"):", kwargs)
1059

1061# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1062# --- Class geometry ---------------------------------------------------------
1063# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1064class geometry(Processing):
1065    """
1066    Geometric transformation operation for HDR images.
1067
1068    This class implements basic geometric transformations for HDR images,
1069    including cropping and rotation. It allows modifying image dimensions
1070    and orientation while preserving HDR data precision.
1071
1072    Supported Transformations:
1073    - Cropping: Image dimension adjustment
1074    - Rotation: Image rotation by specified angle
1075    - Orientation: Image orientation management (up/down)
1076
1077    Parameters:
1078        ratio (tuple): Target aspect ratio (width, height)
1079        up (int): Image orientation (0: up, 1: down)
1080        rotation (float): Rotation angle in degrees
1081
1082    Notes:
1083        - Transformations are applied in order: rotation then cropping
1084        - Cropping preserves the specified aspect ratio
1085        - Rotation uses bilinear interpolation
1086        - HDR values are preserved during transformations
1087    """
1088    
1089    def compute(self, img, **kwargs): 
1090        """Geometric transformation operator.
1091
1092        Args:
1093            img (hdrCore.image.Image,Required): Input image
1094            kwargs (dict,Optional): Transformation parameters
1095                'ratio': (int,int) - Target aspect ratio (width, height)
1096                'up': int - Image orientation (0: up, 1: down)
1097                'rotation': float - Rotation angle in degrees
1098
1099                Default values = { 'ratio': (16,9), 'up': 0, 'rotation': 0.0}
1100                
1101        Returns:
1102            hdrCore.image.Image: Transformed image
1103
1104        Raises:
1105            ValueError: If transformation parameters are invalid
1106        """
1107        start = timer()
1108        defaultValue = { 'ratio': (16,9), 'up': 0,'rotation': 0.0}
1109        if not kwargs: kwargs = defaultValue  # default value 
1110        ratio =     kwargs['ratio']     if 'ratio' in kwargs.keys()     else defaultValue['ratio']
1111        up =        kwargs['up']        if 'up' in kwargs.keys()        else defaultValue['up']
1112        rotation =  kwargs['rotation']  if 'rotation' in kwargs.keys()  else defaultValue['rotation']
1113
1114        # results image
1115        res = copy.deepcopy(img)
1116
1117        ##if kwargs != defaultValue:
1118        h,w, c = res.colorData.shape
1119        imgRatio = w/h
1120
1121        if int(imgRatio*1000) != int(ratio[0]/ratio[1]*1000):
1122            if imgRatio < (ratio[0]/ratio[1]):
1123                hh16x9 = int(w*ratio[1]/ratio[0]/2)
1124                ch = h//2
1125                up = int((h//2-hh16x9)*up/100)
1126                res.colorData = res.colorData[(ch-hh16x9-up):(ch+hh16x9-up),:,:]
1127                res.shape = res.colorData.shape
1128            else:
1129                ww16x9 = int(h*ratio[0]/ratio[1]/2)
1130                ch = w//2
1131                res.colorData = res.colorData[:,(ch-ww16x9):(ch+ww16x9),:]
1132                res.shape = res.colorData.shape
1133
1134        if rotation != 0 :
1135            res.colorData = skimage.transform.rotate(res.colorData, rotation, clip = False, resize=False)
1136            h,w, _ = res.colorData.shape
1137            hh,ww = utils.croppRotated(h,w,rotation)
1138            res.colorData = res.colorData[int(h/2-hh/2):int(h/2+hh/2), int(w/2-ww/2):int(w/2+ww/2),:]
1139            res.shape = res.colorData.shape
1140
1141        end = timer()
1142        if pref.verbose: print(" [PROCESS-PROFILING] (",end-start,")>> geometry(",res.name,"):", kwargs)
1143
1144        return res
1145# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1146
1147# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1148# --- Class ProcessPipe ------------------------------------------------------
1149# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1150class ProcessPipe(object):
1151    """
1152    Non-destructive HDR image processing pipeline.
1153
1154    This class implements an image processing pipeline that allows chaining
1155    operations in a non-destructive manner. It manages operation states,
1156    preserves the original image, and optimizes performance.
1157
1158    Architecture:
1159    The pipeline consists of processing nodes (ProcessNode) that encapsulate
1160    processing operations (Processing). Each node maintains its own state
1161    and parameters, enabling non-destructive editing.
1162
1163    Memory Management:
1164    - Original image is preserved
1165    - Intermediate images are computed on demand
1166    - Automatic resizing optimizes performance
1167    - Memory is efficiently managed for large images
1168
1169    Features:
1170    - Processing operation chaining
1171    - Operation state preservation
1172    - Optimized result computation
1173    - Metadata management
1174    - Result export
1175    - HDR preview
1176
1177    Attributes:
1178        - originalImage (hdrCore.image.Image): Original source image
1179        - __inputImage (hdrCore.image.Image): Current input image
1180        - __outputImage (hdrCore.image.Image): Current output image
1181        - processNodes ([ProcessNode]): List of processing nodes
1182        - previewHDR (bool): HDR preview state
1183        - previewHDR_process (): HDR preview process
1184
1185    Class Attributes:
1186        autoResize (bool): Enables automatic resizing
1187        maxSize (int): Maximum size for resizing
1188        maxWorking (int): Maximum size for processing
1189
1190    Usage:
1191        # Create a pipeline
1192        pipe = ProcessPipe()
1193        
1194        # Set source image
1195        pipe.setImage(source_image)
1196        
1197        # Add operations
1198        pipe.append(exposure(), {'value': 1.0})
1199        pipe.append(contrast(), {'value': 10})
1200        
1201        # Execute pipeline
1202        result = pipe.compute()
1203        
1204        # Export results
1205        pipe.export("output/", size=(1920, 1080))
1206
1207    Technical Notes:
1208        - Non-destructive pipeline
1209        - Automatic memory optimization
1210        - HDR processing support
1211        - Metadata management
1212        - Real-time preview
1213    """
1214    
1215    # autoresizing for fast computation
1216    autoResize =    True
1217    maxSize =       1200 
1218    maxWorking =    1200 #800
1219     
1220    # -------------------------------------------------------------------------
1221    # --- Class ProcessNode --------------------------------------------------
1222    # -------------------------------------------------------------------------
1223    class ProcessNode(object):
1224        """
1225        Processing node encapsulating a processing operation.
1226
1227        This inner class encapsulates a processing operation (Processing)
1228        with its parameters and state. It manages conditional execution
1229        of operations and parameter persistence.
1230
1231        Attributes:
1232            - name (str): Processing node name
1233            - process (hdrCore.processing.Processing): Processing operation
1234            - params (dict): Current parameters
1235            - defaultParams (dict): Default parameters
1236            - requireUpdate (bool): Update required state
1237            - outputImage (hdrCore.image.Image): Output image
1238
1239        Notes:
1240            - Identifiant unique pour chaque nœud
1241            - Gestion d'état pour optimisation
1242            - Paramètres persistants
1243            - Support de l'exécution conditionnelle
1244        """
1245
1246        id = 0
1247
1248        def __init__(self,process,paramDict=None,name=None):
1249            """
1250            Initialize a new processing node.
1251
1252            Args:
1253                process (Processing): Processing operation to encapsulate
1254                paramDict (dict, optional): Initial parameters for the operation
1255                name (str, optional): Custom name for the node. If None, a default
1256                    name is generated using 'process_' prefix and a unique ID.
1257
1258            Notes:
1259                - Each node gets a unique ID for identification
1260                - Default parameters are stored for reset capability
1261                - Node state is initialized as requiring update
1262            """
1263            self.name = 'noname'
1264            if not name:
1265                self.name = 'process_'+str(ProcessNode.id)
1266                ProcessNode.id += 1
1267            else:
1268                self.name = name
1269            self.process = process
1270            self.params = paramDict
1271            self.defaultParams = copy.deepcopy(paramDict)
1272            self.requireUpdate = True # require a first process
1273            self.outputImage = None # store results image (Image)
1274
1275        def compute(self,img):
1276            """
1277            Execute the processing operation on the input image.
1278
1279            Args:
1280                img (hdrCore.image.Image): Input image to process
1281
1282            Notes:
1283                - Operation is executed only if update is required
1284                - Output image is cached for subsequent calls
1285                - Node state is updated after computation
1286            """
1287            self.outputImage = self.process.compute(img,**self.params)
1288            self.requireUpdate = False
1289
1290        def condCompute(self,img):
1291            """
1292            Conditionally execute the processing operation.
1293
1294            Args:
1295                img (hdrCore.image.Image): Input image to process
1296
1297            Notes:
1298                - Checks if parameters differ from defaults
1299                - Only executes if parameters have been modified
1300                - Preserves input image if no changes needed
1301            """
1302            if self.requireUpdate: self.compute(img)
1303            pass
1304
1305        def setParameters(self,paramDict):
1306            """
1307            Update the node's processing parameters.
1308
1309            Args:
1310                paramDict (dict): New parameter values to set
1311
1312            Notes:
1313                - Parameters are deep copied to prevent external modification
1314                - Node is marked for update after parameter change
1315                - Invalid parameters are ignored
1316            """
1317            if pref.verbose: print(" [PROCESS] >> ProcessNode.setParameters(",self.name,"):",paramDict)
1318            self.params=paramDict
1319            self.requireUpdate = True
1320
1321        def getParameters(self):
1322            """
1323            Retrieve the current processing parameters.
1324
1325            Returns:
1326                dict: Current parameter values
1327
1328            Notes:
1329                - Returns a copy of parameters to prevent external modification
1330                - Includes all parameters, even if unchanged from defaults
1331            """
1332            return self.params
1333
1334        def toDict(self):
1335            """
1336            Convert the node to a dictionary representation.
1337
1338            Returns:
1339                dict: Dictionary containing node name and parameters
1340
1341            Notes:
1342                - Used for serialization and state saving
1343                - Format: {node_name: parameters_dict}
1344                - Preserves parameter values for later restoration
1345            """
1346            return {self.name: self.params}
1347    # -------------------------------------------------------------------------
1348    # --- End of ProcessNode -------------------------------------------
1349    # -------------------------------------------------------------------------
1350    
1351    def __init__(self):
1352        """
1353        Initialize a new processing pipeline.
1354
1355        Creates an empty pipeline ready to accept processing operations.
1356        Initializes internal state and image storage.
1357
1358        Attributes:
1359            originalImage (hdrCore.image.Image): Original source image
1360            __inputImage (hdrCore.image.Image): Current input image
1361            __outputImage (hdrCore.image.Image): Current output image
1362            processNodes (list): List of processing nodes
1363            previewHDR (bool): HDR preview state
1364            previewHDR_process (): HDR preview process
1365
1366        Notes:
1367            - Pipeline starts empty with no operations
1368            - All image references are initialized to None
1369            - HDR preview is enabled by default
1370        """
1371        self.originalImage = None # 
1372        self.__inputImage = None
1373        self.__outputImage = None
1374        self.processNodes = []
1375
1376        self.previewHDR = True
1377        self.previewHDR_process = None
1378
1379    def append(self,process,paramDict=None,name=None):
1380        """
1381        Add a processing operation to the pipeline.
1382
1383        Args:
1384            process (Processing): Processing operation to add
1385            paramDict (dict, optional): Initial parameters for the operation
1386            name (str, optional): Custom name for the operation node
1387
1388        Returns:
1389            int: Index of the newly added operation in the pipeline
1390
1391        Notes:
1392            - Operation is encapsulated in a ProcessNode
1393            - Parameters are optional and can be set later
1394            - Custom names help identify operations in the pipeline
1395        """
1396        if isinstance(process,Processing): process = ProcessPipe.ProcessNode(process,paramDict,name) # encapsulate process in processNode
1397        self.processNodes.append(process)
1398        return len(self.processNodes)-1 # return index of process (list[index])
1399
1400    def getName(self):
1401        """
1402        Get the name of the current output image.
1403
1404        Returns:
1405            str: Name of the output image, or None if no image is set
1406
1407        Notes:
1408            - Returns None if pipeline has no output image
1409            - Name is preserved from input image through processing
1410        """
1411        return self.__outputImage.name
1412
1413    def setImage(self,img):
1414        """
1415        Set the input image for the processing pipeline.
1416
1417        Args:
1418            img (hdrCore.image.Image): Input image to process
1419
1420        Notes:
1421            - Creates deep copies of the image for safety
1422            - Applies automatic resizing if enabled
1423            - Converts to linear color space if needed
1424            - Initializes pipeline metadata from image
1425            - Marks all operations for update
1426        """
1427        if pref.verbose: print(" [PROCESS] >> ProcessPipe.setImage(",img.name,")")
1428
1429        # resize input for faster computation
1430        if ProcessPipe.autoResize:
1431            height, width, channels = img.shape
1432            if (height>= width) and (height>ProcessPipe.maxWorking):
1433                img = img.process(resize(),size=(ProcessPipe.maxWorking,None))
1434
1435            elif (width>=height) and (width>ProcessPipe.maxWorking):   
1436                img = img.process(resize(),size=(None,ProcessPipe.maxWorking))
1437
1438        self.originalImage= copy.deepcopy(img)
1439
1440        # a copy is set as __outputImage
1441        self.__outputImage = copy.deepcopy(img)
1442     
1443        if not img.linear: 
1444            if pref.computation == 'python':
1445                start = timer()
1446                img.colorData =     np.float32(colour.cctf_decoding(img.colorData, function='sRGB'))
1447                img.linear =        True
1448
1449            elif pref.computation == 'numba':
1450                start = timer()
1451                img.colorData= numbafun.numba_cctf_sRGB_decoding(img.colorData)
1452                img.linear =        True
1453
1454            elif pref.computation == 'cuda':
1455                start = timer()
1456                img.colorData =     numbafun.cuda_cctf_sRGB_decoding(img.colorData) # encode to prime
1457                img.linear =        True
1458
1459            dt = timer() - start
1460
1461        # input image is set as __inputImage
1462        self.__inputImage = img
1463
1464        # requireUpdate is set to True
1465        for processNode in self.processNodes: processNode.requireUpdate = True
1466
1467        # recover medata to initialize processPipe
1468        if 'processpipe' in img.metadata.metadata:
1469            processpipeMetadata = img.metadata.metadata['processpipe']
1470
1471            if isinstance(processpipeMetadata,list):
1472                for pMeta in processpipeMetadata:
1473
1474                    key = list(pMeta.keys())[0]
1475                    param = pMeta[key]
1476                    idProcess = self.getProcessNodeByName(key)
1477                    if idProcess != -1:
1478                        self.setParameters(idProcess,param)
1479
1480    def setOutput(self, img):
1481        """
1482        Set the output image of the pipeline.
1483
1484        Args:
1485            img (hdrCore.image.Image): New output image
1486
1487        Notes:
1488            - Creates a deep copy of the image
1489            - Updates pipeline state
1490            - Preserves original and input images
1491        """
1492        self.__outputImage = copy.deepcopy(img)
1493        pass
1494
1495    def getInputImage(self):
1496        """
1497        Get the current input image.
1498
1499        Returns:
1500            hdrCore.image.Image: Current input image, or None if not set
1501
1502        Notes:
1503            - Returns None if no image has been set
1504            - Image may be resized from original if autoResize is enabled
1505        """
1506        return self.__inputImage
1507
1508    def getImage(self,toneMap=True):
1509        """
1510        Get the current output image with optional tone mapping.
1511
1512        Args:
1513            toneMap (bool, optional): Whether to apply tone mapping (default: True)
1514
1515        Returns:
1516            hdrCore.image.Image: Processed output image, or None if no image is set
1517
1518        Notes:
1519            - Applies tone mapping if requested and image is HDR
1520            - Handles color space conversions automatically
1521            - Preserves original image data
1522            - Returns None if pipeline has no image
1523        """
1524        if isinstance(self.originalImage, image.Image): # if pipe has an image
1525            # conditionnal encoding or decoding to prime, linear
1526
1527            if (not self.originalImage.linear) and self.__outputImage.linear:
1528                self.__outputImage.colorData = colour.cctf_encoding(self.__outputImage.colorData, function='sRGB')
1529                self.__outputImage.linear =  False
1530
1531                if pref.verbose: print(" [PROCESS] >> ProcessPipe.getImage(",self.__outputImage.name,", toneMap:",toneMap,"): encode to sRGB !")
1532
1533            elif self.__outputImage.isHDR() and self.__outputImage.linear and toneMap:
1534                self.__outputImage.colorData = colour.cctf_encoding(self.__outputImage.colorData, function='sRGB')
1535                self.__outputImage.linear =  False
1536
1537                if pref.verbose: print(" [PROCESS] >> ProcessPipe.getImage(",self.__outputImage.name,", ,toneMap:",toneMap,"): tone map using cctf encoding !")
1538
1539            elif self.__outputImage.isHDR() and (not self.__outputImage.linear) and (not toneMap):
1540                self.__outputImage.colorData = colour.cctf_decoding(self.__outputImage.colorData, function='sRGB')
1541                self.__outputImage.linear =  True
1542
1543                if pref.verbose: print(" [PROCESS] >> ProcessPipe.getImage(",self.__outputImage.name,", toneMap:",toneMap,"): decoding to linear colorspace !")
1544
1545            elif (not self.__outputImage.linear) and (not toneMap):
1546                self.__outputImage.colorData = colour.cctf_decoding(self.__outputImage.colorData, function='sRGB')
1547                self.__outputImage.linear =  True
1548
1549                if pref.verbose: print(" [PROCESS] >> ProcessPipe.getImage(",self.__outputImage.name,", toneMap:",toneMap,"): decoding to linear colorspace !")
1550
1551            else:
1552                if pref.verbose: print(" [PROCESS] >> ProcessPipe.getImage(",self.__outputImage.name,", toneMap:",toneMap,"): just return output !")
1553
1554            return self.__outputImage
1555        else: return None
1556
1557    def compute(self,progress=None):
1558        """
1559        Execute the processing pipeline.
1560
1561        Args:
1562            progress (object, optional): Progress tracking object with showMessage
1563                and repaint methods
1564
1565        Notes:
1566            - Executes operations in sequence
1567            - Updates progress if tracking object provided
1568            - Preserves original image
1569            - Handles operation dependencies
1570            - Updates output image after completion
1571        """
1572        if self.__inputImage:
1573
1574            if len(self.processNodes)>0: 
1575                # first node
1576                if progress:
1577                    progress.showMessage('computing: '+self.processNodes[0].name+' start!')
1578                    progress.repaint()
1579                self.processNodes[0].condCompute(self.__inputImage)
1580                if progress:
1581                    progress.showMessage('computing: '+self.processNodes[0].name+' done!')
1582                    progress.repaint()
1583                # other nodes
1584                for i,processNode in enumerate(self.processNodes[1:]):
1585                    if progress:
1586                        progress.showMessage('computing: '+processNode.name+' start!')
1587                        progress.repaint()
1588                    processNode.condCompute(self.processNodes[i].outputImage)
1589                    if progress:
1590                        progress.showMessage('computing: '+processNode.name+' done!')
1591                        progress.repaint()
1592            self.__outputImage=self.processNodes[-1].outputImage
1593
1594    def setParameters(self,id,paramDicts):
1595        """
1596        Update parameters for a processing operation.
1597
1598        Args:
1599            id (int): Index of the operation to update
1600            paramDicts (dict): New parameter values
1601
1602        Notes:
1603            - Updates operation parameters
1604            - Marks dependent operations for update
1605            - Updates pipeline metadata
1606        """
1607        self.processNodes[id].setParameters(paramDicts)
1608        for processNode in self.processNodes[id:]: processNode.requireUpdate = True
1609        self.updateProcessPipeMetadata()
1610
1611    def getParameters(self,id):
1612        """
1613        Get current parameters for a processing operation.
1614
1615        Args:
1616            id (int): Index of the operation
1617
1618        Returns:
1619            dict: Current parameter values for the operation
1620
1621        Notes:
1622            - Returns None if operation index is invalid
1623            - Returns a copy of parameters to prevent modification
1624        """
1625        return self.processNodes[id].getParameters()
1626
1627    def getProcessNodeByName(self,name):
1628        """
1629        Find a processing operation by name.
1630
1631        Args:
1632            name (str): Name of the operation to find
1633
1634        Returns:
1635            int: Index of the operation, or -1 if not found
1636
1637        Notes:
1638            - Returns -1 if no operation matches the name
1639            - Names are case-sensitive
1640        """
1641        id = -1
1642        for i, process in enumerate(self.processNodes):
1643            if process.name == name:
1644                id  = i
1645                break
1646        return id
1647
1648    def __repr__(self):
1649        """
1650        Get a string representation of the pipeline.
1651
1652        Returns:
1653            str: Detailed string representation of the pipeline state
1654
1655        Notes:
1656            - Includes input image name
1657            - Lists all operations with their parameters
1658            - Shows update status for each operation
1659        """
1660        res =   "<class ProcessPipe: \n"+ \
1661                "\t inputImage: "
1662        if self.__inputImage:
1663            res += self.__inputImage.name + "\n"
1664        else:
1665            res += "None" +"\n"
1666        for i,p in enumerate(self.processNodes):
1667            res += "\t["+str(i)+"]:"+p.name+"( params: "+str(p.params)+"| requireUpdate: "+str(p.requireUpdate)+") \n"
1668        return res+">"
1669
1670    def __str__(self):
1671        """
1672        Get a string representation of the pipeline.
1673
1674        Returns:
1675            str: Same as __repr__
1676
1677        Notes:
1678            - Alias for __repr__ for consistency
1679        """
1680        return self.__repr__()
1681
1682    def toDict(self):
1683        """
1684        Convert the pipeline to a dictionary representation.
1685
1686        Returns:
1687            list: List of operation dictionaries
1688
1689        Notes:
1690            - Used for serialization and state saving
1691            - Each operation is represented as a dictionary
1692            - Preserves operation order and parameters
1693        """
1694        res = []
1695        for p in self.processNodes: res.append(p.toDict())
1696        return res
1697
1698    def updateProcessPipeMetadata(self):
1699        """
1700        Update metadata for all images in the pipeline.
1701
1702        Notes:
1703            - Updates metadata for original, input and output images
1704            - Preserves pipeline state in metadata
1705            - Handles missing images gracefully
1706        """
1707        ppMeta = self.toDict()
1708        if pref.verbose: print(" [PROCESS] >> ProcessPipe.updateMetadata(","):",ppMeta)
1709        if isinstance(self.originalImage,image.Image):  self.originalImage.metadata.metadata['processpipe'] =   copy.deepcopy(ppMeta)
1710        if isinstance(self.__inputImage,image.Image):   self.__inputImage.metadata.metadata['processpipe'] =    copy.deepcopy(ppMeta)
1711        if isinstance(self.__outputImage,image.Image):  self.__outputImage.metadata.metadata['processpipe'] =   copy.deepcopy(ppMeta)
1712
1713    def updateUserMeta(self,tagRootName,meta):
1714        """
1715        Update user metadata for all images in the pipeline.
1716
1717        Args:
1718            tagRootName (str): Root tag for the metadata
1719            meta (dict): Metadata to store
1720
1721        Notes:
1722            - Updates metadata for all pipeline images
1723            - Preserves existing metadata
1724            - Handles missing images gracefully
1725        """
1726        if pref.verbose: print(" [PROCESS] >> ProcessPipe.updateUserMeta(",")")
1727        if isinstance(self.originalImage,image.Image):  self.originalImage.metadata.metadata[tagRootName] =   copy.deepcopy(meta)
1728        if isinstance(self.__inputImage,image.Image):   self.__inputImage.metadata.metadata[tagRootName] =    copy.deepcopy(meta)
1729        if isinstance(self.__outputImage,image.Image):  self.__outputImage.metadata.metadata[tagRootName] =   copy.deepcopy(meta)
1730
1731    def export(self,dirName,size=None,to=None,progress=None):
1732        """
1733        Export the processed image to a file.
1734
1735        Args:
1736            dirName (str): Directory to save the exported image
1737            size (tuple, optional): Target size for export (width, height)
1738            to (dict, optional): Export settings including scaling and tags
1739            progress (object, optional): Progress tracking object
1740
1741        Returns:
1742            hdrCore.image.Image: Exported image
1743
1744        Notes:
1745            - Preserves original image and metadata
1746            - Applies resizing if specified
1747            - Handles HDR/SDR conversion
1748            - Updates metadata for export
1749            - Restores pipeline state after export
1750        """
1751        # recover input and processpipe metadata
1752        input = copy.deepcopy(self.originalImage)
1753        input.metadata.metadata['processpipe'] = self.toDict()
1754        input.metadata.save()
1755
1756        # load full size image
1757        img = image.Image.read(self.originalImage.path+'/'+self.originalImage.name)
1758        if size: img = img.process(resize(),size=(None, size[1]))
1759
1760        ProcessPipe.autoResize = False # set off autoresize
1761
1762        self.setImage(img)
1763
1764        self.compute(progress=progress)
1765        ###### res = hdrCore.coreC.coreCcompute(img, self)
1766
1767        res = self.getImage(toneMap=False)
1768        res = res.process(clip())
1769
1770        res.metadata = copy.deepcopy(img.metadata)                  # exif, hdr use case, ...
1771        res.metadata.metadata['processpipe'] = None                  # reset process pipe  
1772        
1773        ProcessPipe.autoResize = True# restore autoresize
1774        if to:
1775            res.colorData = res.colorData*to['scaling']
1776            res.metadata.metadata['display'] = to['tag']     # set display
1777
1778        if dirName:
1779            pathExport = os.path.join(dirName, img.name[:-4]+to['post']+'.hdr')
1780            res.write(pathExport)
1781
1782        #restore input
1783        self.setImage(input)
1784        self.compute()
1785
1786        return res

def XYZ_to_Lab(XYZ): 
124def XYZ_to_Lab(XYZ):
125    """
126    Convert pixel array from XYZ to Lab color space.
127
128    Args:
129        XYZ (numpy.ndarray): Array of pixels in XYZ color space
130            
131    Returns:
132        numpy.ndarray: Array of pixels in Lab color space
133    """
134    return colour.XYZ_to_Lab(XYZ, illuminant=np.array([ 0.3127, 0.329 ]))
