def Lab_to_sRGB(Lab, apply_cctf_encoding=True, clip=False): 
136def Lab_to_sRGB(Lab, apply_cctf_encoding=True, clip = False):
137    """
138    Convert pixel array from Lab to sRGB color space.
139
140    Args:
141        Lab (numpy.ndarray): Array of pixels in Lab color space
142        apply_cctf_encoding (bool, optional): Apply sRGB CCTF encoding function (default: True)
143        clip (bool, optional): Clip values beyond color space limits (default: False)
144            
145    Returns:
146        numpy.ndarray: Array of pixels in sRGB color space
147    """

149    RGB =  colour.XYZ_to_sRGB(XYZ,
150                              illuminant=np.array([ 0.3127, 0.329 ]), 
151                              chromatic_adaptation_transform='CAT02', 
152                              apply_cctf_encoding=apply_cctf_encoding)
153    if clip:
154        RGB[RGB<0] = 0
155        RGB[RGB>1] = 1
156    return RGB

class Processing: 
202class Processing(object):
203    """
204    Base class for HDR image processing operations.
205
206    This class defines the common interface for all image processing operations
207    in the HDR pipeline. It provides the basic structure and common mechanisms
208    for operation execution.
209
210    Interface:
211    Each processing operation must implement:
212    - compute() method: Operation execution
213    - Parameter management: Storage and validation
214    - Operation state: Change tracking
215
216    Features:
217    - Non-destructive operations
218    - HDR processing support
219    - Parameter validation
220    - State management
221    - Performance profiling
222
223    Usage:
224        class MyOperation(Processing):
225            def compute(self, img, **kwargs):
226                # Operation implementation
227                return result_image
228
229    Notes:
230        - All operations inherit from this class
231        - Parameters are validated before execution
232        - Profiling is automatic if enabled
233        - State is preserved between executions
234    """
235
236    def compute(self, image, **kwargs):
237        """Execute the processing operation.
238
239        Args:
240            image (hdrCore.image.Image): Input image to process
241            **kwargs: Operation-specific parameters
242
243        Returns:
244            hdrCore.image.Image: Resulting processed image
245
246        Raises:
247            NotImplementedError: If method is not implemented
248            ValueError: If parameters are invalid
249        """
250        raise NotImplementedError("compute() method must be implemented")

Base class for HDR image processing operations.

This class defines the common interface for all image processing operations in the HDR pipeline. It provides the basic structure and common mechanisms for operation execution.

Interface: Each processing operation must implement:

  • compute() method: Operation execution
  • Parameter management: Storage and validation
  • Operation state: Change tracking

Features:

  • Non-destructive operations
  • HDR processing support
  • Parameter validation
  • State management
  • Performance profiling

Usage: class MyOperation(Processing): def compute(self, img, **kwargs): # Operation implementation return result_image

Notes: - All operations inherit from this class - Parameters are validated before execution - Profiling is automatic if enabled - State is preserved between executions

243        Returns:
244            hdrCore.image.Image: Resulting processed image

248            ValueError: If parameters are invalid

class tmo_cctf(Processing): 
255class tmo_cctf(Processing):
256    """
257    Tone mapping operator using Color Correction Transfer Functions (CCTF).
258    
259    This class implements tone mapping for HDR images using standard color
260    correction transfer functions, primarily sRGB gamma encoding. It converts
261    HDR linear data to display-ready format suitable for standard monitors.
262    
263    The operator transforms HDR images from linear space to gamma-corrected
264    space, effectively creating SDR representations of HDR content.
265    """
266
267    def compute(self,img,**kwargs):
268        """
269        Apply CCTF-based tone mapping to HDR images.
270
271        Args:
272            img (hdrCore.image.Image): Input HDR image
273            **kwargs: Processing parameters
274                function (str, optional): CCTF function to use (default: 'sRGB')
275                
276        Returns:
277            hdrCore.image.Image: Tone-mapped SDR image with gamma correction applied
278            
279        Note:
280            Only processes HDR images. SDR images are returned unchanged.
281            The output image type is changed to SDR with non-linear encoding.
282        """
283        function = 'sRGB'
284        if 'function' in kwargs: function = kwargs['function']
285 
286        res = copy.deepcopy(img)
287
288        # can tone map HDR only 
289        if (img.type == image.imageType.HDR):
290
291            # encode
292            imgRGBprime = colour.cctf_encoding(res.colorData,function=function)
293
294            # update attributes
295            res.colorData       = imgRGBprime
296            res.type            = image.imageType.SDR
297            res.linear          = False
298            res.scalingFactor   = 1.0
299            res.colorSpace      = colour.models.RGB_COLOURSPACES[function].copy()
300
301        return res

class exposure(Processing): 
305class exposure(Processing):
306    """
307    Exposure adjustment processing with auto-exposure capabilities.
308    
309    This class provides exposure control for HDR images, allowing both manual
310    exposure adjustments in EV (Exposure Value) stops and automatic exposure
311    calculation based on histogram analysis.
312    
313    The exposure adjustment is performed in linear RGB space and uses standard
314    photographic exposure calculations (powers of 2).
315    """
316    
317    def compute(self,img,**kwargs):
318        """
319        Apply exposure adjustment to the image.
320
321        Args:
322            img (hdrCore.image.Image): Input image
323            **kwargs: Processing parameters
324                EV (float, optional): Exposure adjustment in stops (default: 0.0)
325                
326        Returns:
327            hdrCore.image.Image: Image with exposure adjustment applied
328            
329        Note:
330            Exposure adjustment is performed in linear RGB space. Non-linear
331            images are automatically converted to linear, processed, and
332            returned in linear space.
333        """
334        start= timer()
335        defaultEV = 0.0
336        if not kwargs: kwargs = {'EV': defaultEV}  # default value
337        
338
339        if 'EV' in kwargs : EV = kwargs['EV']
340        else:               EV = defaultEV
341 
342        res = copy.deepcopy(img)
343
344        if EV != defaultEV:
345            # exposure is done in linear RGB
346            if not res.linear:
347                
348                if pref.computation == 'python':
349                    start = timer()
350                    res.colorData =     colour.cctf_decoding(res.colorData, function='sRGB')
351                    res.linear =        True
352
353                elif pref.computation == 'numba':
354                    start = timer()
355                    res.colorData =     numbafun.numba_cctf_sRGB_decoding(res.colorData) # encode to prime
356                    res.linear =        True
357
358                elif pref.computation == 'cuda':
359                    start = timer()
360                    res.colorData =     numbafun.cuda_cctf_sRGB_decoding(res.colorData) # encode to prime
361                    res.linear =        True
362
363                dt = timer() - start
364
365            res.colorData =     res.colorData*math.pow(2,EV)
366
367        end = timer()
368        if pref.verbose: print (" [PROCESS-PROFILING](",end - start,") >> exposure(",img.name,"):", kwargs)
369
370        return res
371
372    def auto(self,img):
373        """
374        Calculate optimal exposure using histogram analysis.
375        
376        This method analyzes the image histogram to determine the optimal
377        exposure value that maximizes the use of the available dynamic range
378        while avoiding overexposure.
379
380        Args:
381            img (hdrCore.image.Image): Input image for analysis
382                
383        Returns:
384            dict: Dictionary containing the optimal exposure value
385                  {'EV': optimal_exposure_value}
386                  
387        Note:
388            Uses multi-threaded histogram analysis across multiple exposure
389            values to find the exposure that maximizes histogram spread
390            without clipping highlights.
391        """
392        minEV, maxEV, step =  -10,10,0.25
393        evs = np.linspace(minEV,maxEV,num=int((maxEV-minEV)/step)+1)
394
395        rgb = copy.deepcopy(img.colorData)
396        nbPix = rgb.shape[0]*rgb.shape[1]
397
398        if not img.linear:  rgbLinear = colour.cctf_decoding(rgb,function='sRGB')
399        else:               rgbLinear = rgb
400
401        bins = np.linspace(0,1,25+1)
402
403        # local method for pool (not static!)
404        def evEval(ev):
405            """
406            Evaluate exposure value by histogram analysis.
407
408            Args:
409                ev (float): Exposure value to evaluate
410                    
411            Returns:
412                float: Quality metric for this exposure value
413            """
414            rgb_ev = rgbLinear*math.pow(2,ev)
415            rgb_ev_prime = colour.cctf_encoding(rgb_ev,function='sRGB')
416            rgb_ev_prime[rgb_ev_prime>1] = 1
417            XYZ = colour.sRGB_to_XYZ(rgb_ev_prime, apply_cctf_decoding=False)
418            Y = utils.ndarray2vector(XYZ)[:,1]
419            nphist_ev_prime, npedges = np.histogram(Y, bins)
420            nphist_ev_prime = nphist_ev_prime/nbPix
421            sumH = np.cumsum(nphist_ev_prime[1:-1])[-1]
422
423            return sumH
424
425        _pool = pathos.multiprocessing.ProcessPool()
426        results = _pool.map( evEval, evs)
427        sumsH  = list(results)
428        
429        bestEV = evs[np.argmax(sumsH)]
430        if pref.verbose: print('  [PROCESS] >> exposure.auto(',img.name,'):BEST EV:',bestEV)
431      
432        return {'EV':bestEV}

This class provides exposure control for HDR images, allowing both manual exposure adjustments in EV (Exposure Value) stops and automatic exposure calculation based on histogram analysis.

The exposure adjustment is performed in linear RGB space and uses standard photographic exposure calculations (powers of 2).

class contrast(Processing): 
436class contrast(Processing):
437    """
438    Contrast adjustment processing with gamma-based scaling.
439    
440    This class provides contrast control by scaling pixel values around a
441    midpoint using a configurable scaling factor. The contrast adjustment
442    is performed in gamma-corrected space for perceptually uniform results.
443    
444    Positive contrast values increase contrast, while negative values decrease
445    contrast. The scaling is applied around the 0.5 midpoint value.
446    """
447    
448    def compute(self,img,**kwargs):
449        """
450        Apply contrast adjustment to the image.
451
452        Args:
453            img (hdrCore.image.Image): Input image
454            **kwargs: Processing parameters
455                contrast (float, optional): Contrast adjustment value (default: 0)
456                                          Range typically -100 to +100
457
458        Returns:
459            hdrCore.image.Image: Image with contrast adjustment applied
460            
461        Note:
462            Contrast adjustment is performed in gamma-corrected space.
463            Linear images are automatically converted to gamma space,
464            processed, and returned in gamma space.
465        """
466        start = timer()
467        defaultContrast =   0.0
468        maxContrastFactor = 2.0     ###### 5.0
469        if not kwargs: kwargs = { "contrast": defaultContrast }  # default value 
470
471
472        if 'contrast' in kwargs :   contrastValue = kwargs['contrast']
473        else:                       contrastValue = defaultContrast
474
475        res = copy.deepcopy(img)
476
477        if contrastValue != defaultContrast:
478            # contrast scaling is computed in prime colorspace
479            if img.linear: 
480                if pref.computation == 'python':
481                    start = timer()
482                    res.colorData =     colour.cctf_encoding(res.colorData, function='sRGB') # encode to prime
483                    res.linear =        False
484
485                elif pref.computation == 'numba':
486                    start = timer()
487                    res.colorData =     numbafun.numba_cctf_sRGB_encoding(res.colorData) # encode to prime
488                    res.linear =        False
489
490                elif pref.computation == 'cuda':
491                    start = timer()
492                    res.colorData =     numbafun.cuda_cctf_sRGB_encoding(res.colorData) # encode to prime
493                    res.linear =        False
494
495                dt = timer() - start
496
497            # scaling contrast
498            contrastValue = contrastValue/100 
499            if contrastValue>=0.0:
500                scalingFactor = 1*(1-contrastValue)+maxContrastFactor*contrastValue
501            else:
502                contrastValue = -contrastValue
503                scalingFactor = 1*(1-contrastValue)+maxContrastFactor*contrastValue
504                scalingFactor = 1/scalingFactor
505
506            res.colorData = scalingFactor*(res.colorData-0.5)+0.5
507        
508        end=timer()    
509        if pref.verbose: print(" [PROCESS-PROFILING] (",end-start,")>> contrast(",img.name,"):", kwargs)
510
511        return res

Apply contrast adjustment to the image.

Args: img (hdrCore.image.Image): Input image **kwargs: Processing parameters contrast (float, optional): Contrast adjustment value (default: 0) Range typically -100 to +100

Returns: hdrCore.image.Image: Image with contrast adjustment applied

Note: Contrast adjustment is performed in gamma-corrected space. Linear images are automatically converted to gamma space, processed, and returned in gamma space.

class clip(Processing): 
515class clip(Processing):
516    """
517    Value clipping processing for range control.
518    
519    This class provides hard clipping of pixel values to specified minimum
520    and maximum bounds. It's commonly used to ensure pixel values remain
521    within valid ranges after processing operations.
522    
523    The clipping operation is applied uniformly across all color channels
524    and is performed in the current color space of the image.
525    """
526
527    def compute(self,img,**kwargs):
528        """
529        Clip image pixel values to specified range.
530
531        Args:
532            img (hdrCore.image.Image): Input image
533            **kwargs: Processing parameters
534                min (float, optional): Minimum clipping value (default: 0.0)
535                max (float, optional): Maximum clipping value (default: 1.0)
536                
537        Returns:
538            hdrCore.image.Image: Image with values clipped to specified range
539        """ 
540
541        min, max = 0.0, 1.0
542        if 'min' in kwargs: min = kwargs['min']
543        if 'max' in kwargs: max = kwargs['max']
544        
545        res = copy.deepcopy(img)
546        res.colorData[res.colorData>max] = max
547        res.colorData[res.colorData<min] = min
548
549        return res

class ColorSpaceTransform(Processing): 
553class ColorSpaceTransform(Processing):
554    """
555    Color space transformation processing for HDR imaging.
556    
557    This class provides comprehensive color space conversions between sRGB,
558    XYZ, Lab, and other color spaces. It handles proper gamma correction
559    and maintains HDR/SDR image type compatibility during transformations.
560    
561    The transformations are performed using standard illuminants and
562    chromatic adaptation transforms for accurate color reproduction.
563    """
564
565    def compute(self,img,**kwargs):
566        """
567        Transform image between color spaces.
568
569        Args:
570            img (hdrCore.image.Image): Input image
571            **kwargs: Processing parameters
572                dest (str): Destination color space ('Lab', 'sRGB', 'XYZ')
573                
574        Returns:
575            hdrCore.image.Image: Image transformed to destination color space
576            
577        Note:
578            Supports conversions between sRGB, XYZ, and Lab color spaces.
579            Automatically handles gamma correction based on image type and
580            maintains proper linear/non-linear encoding.
581        """ 
582        # first create a copy
583        res = copy.deepcopy(img)
584        if not kwargs: print("WARNING[Processing.ColorSpaceTransform(",img.name,"):", "no destination colour space >> return a copy of image]")
585        else:
586            if not 'dest'in kwargs: print("WARNING[Processing.ColorSpaceTransform(",img.name,"):", "no 'dest' colour space >> return a copy of image]")
587            else: # -> 'colorSpace' found
588                if  kwargs['dest'] == 'Lab': # DEST: Lab
589                    currentCS = img.colorSpace.name
590                    # sRGB to Lab
591                    if currentCS=="sRGB": # sRGB -> Lab
592                        apply_cctf_decoding=True if not img.linear else False
593                        
594                        RGB = res.colorData
595                        XYZ = colour.sRGB_to_XYZ(RGB, illuminant=np.array([ 0.3127, 0.329 ]), chromatic_adaptation_transform='CAT02', apply_cctf_decoding=apply_cctf_decoding)           
596                        Lab = colour.XYZ_to_Lab(XYZ, illuminant=np.array([ 0.3127, 0.329 ]))
597                        res.colorData, res.linear, res.colorSpace  = Lab, None,image.ColorSpace.Lab()
598
599                    elif currentCS=="XYZ": # XYZ -> Lab 
600                        XYZ = res.colorData
601                        Lab = colour.XYZ_to_Lab(XYZ, illuminant=np.array([ 0.3127, 0.329 ]))
602                        res.colorData, res.linear,  = Lab, None, image.ColorSpace.XYZ()
603                              
604                    elif currentCS == "Lab": # Lab -> Lab                       
605                        pass # return a copy
606
607                elif kwargs['dest'] == 'sRGB': # DEST: sRGB
608                    currentCS = img.colorSpace.name
609                    if currentCS=="Lab":  # Lab -> sRGB                                                               
610                        Lab = res.colorData
611                        XYZ = colour.Lab_to_XYZ(Lab, illuminant=np.array([ 0.3127, 0.329 ]))
612                        apply_cctf_encoding = False if img.type == image.imageType.HDR  else  True
613                        sRGB = colour.colour.XYZ_to_sRGB(XYZ, illuminant=np.array([ 0.3127, 0.329 ]), chromatic_adaptation_transform='CAT02', apply_cctf_encoding=apply_cctf_encoding)
614                        res.colorData, res.colorSpace, res.linear = sRGB, image.ColorSpace.sRGB(), not apply_cctf_encoding
615                    
616                    elif currentCS == "XYZ":# XYZ -> sRGB 
617                        XYZ = res.colorData
618                        apply_cctf_encoding = False if (img.type == image.imageType.HDR)  else True
619                        sRGB = colour.colour.XYZ_to_sRGB(XYZ, illuminant=np.array([ 0.3127, 0.329 ]), chromatic_adaptation_transform='CAT02', apply_cctf_encoding=apply_cctf_encoding)
620                        res.colorData, res.colorSpace, res.linear = sRGB, image.ColorSpace.sRGB(), not apply_cctf_encoding
621    
622                    elif currentCS == "sRGB": # sRGB -> sRGB
623                        pass # return a copy             
624                    else:
625                        print("WARNING[Processing.ColorSpaceTransform(",img.name,"):", "'dest' colour space:",kwargs['dest'] , "not yet implemented !]")
626
627                elif kwargs['dest'] == 'XYZ': # DEST: XYZ
628                    currentCS = img.colorSpace.name
629                    if currentCS=="sRGB": # sRGB to XYZ                                                         
630                        apply_cctf_decoding=True if  (img.type == image.imageType.SDR) and (not img.linear) else False
631                        RGB = res.colorData
632                        XYZ = colour.sRGB_to_XYZ(RGB, illuminant=np.array([ 0.3127, 0.329 ]), chromatic_adaptation_transform='CAT02', apply_cctf_decoding=apply_cctf_decoding)           
633                        res.colorData,res.linear , res.colorSpace = XYZ, True, image.ColorSpace.XYZ()
634                        
635                    elif currentCS=="XYZ": # XYZ to XYZ                                                         
636                         pass # return a copy
637                    
638                    elif currentCS == "Lab": # Lab to XYZ
639                        Lab = res.colorData
640                        XYZ = colour.Lab_to_XYZ(Lab, illuminant=np.array([ 0.3127, 0.329 ]))
641                        res.colorData, res.linear, res.colorSpace = XYZ, True, image.ColorSpace.buildXYZ()
642
643        return res

class resize(Processing): 
647class resize(Processing):
648    """
649    Image resizing processing with anti-aliasing support.
650    
651    This class provides image resizing capabilities while maintaining aspect
652    ratio or allowing arbitrary scaling. It includes anti-aliasing options
653    to prevent artifacts during resizing operations.
654    
655    The resizing can be constrained to width, height, or both dimensions
656    with automatic aspect ratio calculation when only one dimension is specified.
657    """
658    
659    def compute(self,img, size=(None,None),anti_aliasing=False):
660        """
661        Resize the image to specified dimensions.
662
663        Args:
664            img (hdrCore.image.Image): Input image
665            size (tuple, optional): Target size as (height, width) (default: (None, None))
666                                   None values trigger aspect ratio preservation
667            anti_aliasing (bool, optional): Enable anti-aliasing during resize (default: False)
668                
669        Returns:
670            hdrCore.image.Image: Resized image with updated dimensions
671            
672        Note:
673            - If only width specified: height calculated to preserve aspect ratio
674            - If only height specified: width calculated to preserve aspect ratio  
675            - If both None: defaults to height=400 with preserved aspect ratio
676        """
677        res = copy.deepcopy(img)
678        y, x, c =  tuple(res.colorData.shape)
679        ny,nx = size
680        if nx and (not ny): 
681            factor = nx/x
682            res.colorData = skimage.transform.resize(res.colorData, (int(y * factor),nx ), anti_aliasing)
683            res.shape = res.colorData.shape
684        elif (not nx) and ny:
685            factor = ny/y
686            res.colorData = skimage.transform.resize(res.colorData, (ny,int(x * factor)), anti_aliasing)
687            res.shape = res.colorData.shape
688        elif nx and ny:
689            res.colorData = skimage.transform.resize(res.colorData, (ny,nx), anti_aliasing)
690            res.shape = res.colorData.shape
691        elif (not nx) and (not ny):
692            ny=400
693            factor = ny/y
694            res.colorData = skimage.transform.resize(res.colorData, (ny,int(x * factor)), anti_aliasing)
695            res.shape = res.colorData.shape
696        return res

class Ycurve(Processing): 
700class Ycurve(Processing):
701    
702    def compute(self,img,**kwargs):
703        """
704        compute: compute Ycurve according to parameters.
705
706        Args:
707            img (hdrCore.image.Image, Required): image
708            kwargs (dict,Optionnal): parameters gieven as dict
709                
710        Returns:
711            (hdrCore.image.Image, Required): image
712                result of Ycurve processing
713        """ 
714        start =  timer()
715        defaultControlPoints = {'start':[0,0], 
716                                'shadows': [10,10], 
717                                'blacks': [30,30], 
718                                'mediums': [50,50], 
719                                'whites': [70,70], 
720                                'highlights': [90,90], 
721                                'end': [100,100]}
722
723        if not kwargs: kwargs = defaultControlPoints  # default value 
724
725
726        # results image
727        res = copy.deepcopy(img)
728
729        if kwargs != defaultControlPoints:
730
731            if img.linear: 
732                if pref.computation == 'python':
733                    start = timer()
734                    res.colorData =     colour.cctf_encoding(res.colorData, function='sRGB') # encode to prime
735                    res.linear =        False
736
737                elif pref.computation == 'numba':
738                    start = timer()
739                    res.colorData =     numbafun.numba_cctf_sRGB_encoding(res.colorData) # encode to prime
740                    res.linear =        False
741
742                elif pref.computation == 'cuda':
743                    start = timer()
744                    res.colorData =     numbafun.cuda_cctf_sRGB_encoding(res.colorData) # encode to prime
745                    res.linear =        False
746
747                dt = timer() - start
748
749            colorDataY =    sRGB_to_XYZ(res.colorData, apply_cctf_decoding=False)[:,:,1] 
750            # change for multi-threading computation
751            # Ymax =          np.amax(colorDataY)*100
752            # extendedEnd =   [Ymax, kwargs['end'][1]]
753            extendedEnd =   [200, kwargs['end'][1]]
754
755            # create curve adn get y-curve
756            curve =         BSpline.Curve()
757            curve.degree =  2
758            points =        None
759            curve.ctrlpts =     copy.deepcopy([kwargs['start'], kwargs['shadows'], kwargs['blacks'],  kwargs['mediums'], kwargs['whites'], kwargs['highlights'], extendedEnd])
760            curve.knotvector =  utilities.generate_knot_vector(curve.degree, len(curve.ctrlpts))
761            # evaluate curve and get points
762            points = np.asarray(curve.evalpts)/100
763            Y = points[:,0]
764            FY = points[:,1]
765
766            # check validity: same shape
767            if Y.shape == FY.shape:
768                colorDataFY = np.interp(colorDataY, Y,FY)
769
770                # remove zeros
771                Ymin = np.amin(colorDataY[colorDataY>0])
772                colorDataY[colorDataY==0] = Ymin
773
774                # transform colorData
775                res.colorData[:,:,0] = res.colorData[:,:,0]*colorDataFY/colorDataY
776                res.colorData[:,:,1] = res.colorData[:,:,1]*colorDataFY/colorDataY
777                res.colorData[:,:,2] = res.colorData[:,:,2]*colorDataFY/colorDataY
778        
779        end = timer()        
780        if pref.verbose: print(" [PROCESS-PROFILING] (",end - start,")>> Ycurve(",img.name,"):", kwargs)
781
782        return res

Base class for HDR image processing operations.

This class defines the common interface for all image processing operations in the HDR pipeline. It provides the basic structure and common mechanisms for operation execution.

Interface: Each processing operation must implement:

  • compute() method: Operation execution
  • Parameter management: Storage and validation
  • Operation state: Change tracking

Features:

  • Non-destructive operations
  • HDR processing support
  • Parameter validation
  • State management
  • Performance profiling

Usage: class MyOperation(Processing): def compute(self, img, **kwargs): # Operation implementation return result_image

Notes: - All operations inherit from this class - Parameters are validated before execution - Profiling is automatic if enabled - State is preserved between executions

class saturation(Processing): 
786class saturation(Processing):
787    
788    def compute(self,img,**kwargs):
789        """saturation operator
790
791        Args:
792            img (hdrCore.image.Image,Required):  input image
793            kwargs (dict, Optionnal) : parameters
794                'saturation': float
795                'method': str
796                    'method' parameter must be gamma 
797                default value: {'saturation': 0.0, 'method': 'gamma'}
798                
799        Returns:
800            (hdrCore.image.Image): output image
801        """ 
802        start=timer()
803        defaultValue= {'saturation': 0.0, 'method': 'gamma'}
804
805        if not kwargs: kwargs = defaultValue  # default value 
806
807
808        # results image
809        res = copy.deepcopy(img)
810
811        value = kwargs["saturation"]
812        if value != defaultValue['saturation']:
813
814            # go to Lab then Lch
815            if img.linear: 
816                colorLab = sRGB_to_Lab(res.colorData, apply_cctf_decoding=False)
817            else:
818                colorLab = sRGB_to_Lab(res.colorData, apply_cctf_decoding=True)
819            colorLCH = colour.Lab_to_LCHab(colorLab)
820
821            # saturation in Lch (chroma as saturation)
822            gamma = 1/((value/25)+1) if value >= 0 else (-value/25)+1
823            colorLCH[:,:,1] =np.power(colorLCH[:,:,1]/100, gamma)*100
824
825
826            #colorRGB_sat = Lab_to_sRGB(colour.LCHab_to_Lab(colorLCH), apply_cctf_encoding=True)
827            #res.colorData = colorRGB_sat
828            #res.linear = False
829            res.colorData = colorLCH
830            res.linear = False
831            res.colorSpace = image.ColorSpace.build('Lch')
832
833
834        end = timer()
835        if pref.verbose: print(" [PROCESS-PROFILING] (",end - start,")>> saturation(",img.name,"):", kwargs)
836
837        return res

Base class for HDR image processing operations.

This class defines the common interface for all image processing operations in the HDR pipeline. It provides the basic structure and common mechanisms for operation execution.

Interface: Each processing operation must implement:

  • compute() method: Operation execution
  • Parameter management: Storage and validation
  • Operation state: Change tracking

Features:

  • Non-destructive operations
  • HDR processing support
  • Parameter validation
  • State management
  • Performance profiling

Usage: class MyOperation(Processing): def compute(self, img, **kwargs): # Operation implementation return result_image

Notes: - All operations inherit from this class - Parameters are validated before execution - Profiling is automatic if enabled - State is preserved between executions

class colorEditor(Processing): 
 841class colorEditor(Processing):
 842    """
 843    TODO - Documentation de la classe colorEditor
 844    """
 845    
 846    def compute(self,img, **kwargs):
 847        """color editor operator
 848
 849        Args:
 850            img (hdrCore.image.Image, Required): input image
 851            kwargs (dict, Optionnal): parameters
 852                default value= { 'selection': {'lightness': (0,100),'chroma': (0,100),'hue':(0,360)}, 
 853                                'tolerance': 0.1,
 854                                'edit': {'hue':0.0,'exposure':0.0,'contrast':0.0,'saturation':0.0}, 
 855                                'mask': False}                
 856                
 857        Returns:
 858            (hdrCore.image.Image): output image
 859                
 860        """
 861        start = timer()
 862        defaultValue= {'selection': {'lightness': (0,100),'chroma': (0,100),'hue':(0,360)}, 
 863                       'tolerance': 0.1,
 864                       'edit': {'hue':0.0,'exposure':0.0,'contrast':0.0,'saturation':0.0}, 
 865                       'mask': False}
 866
 867        if not kwargs: kwargs = defaultValue  # default value
 868        if not ('selection' in kwargs): kwargs['selection'] =   defaultValue['selection']
 869        if not ('tolerance' in kwargs): kwargs['tolerance'] =   defaultValue['tolerance']
 870        if not ('edit' in kwargs):      kwargs['edit'] =        defaultValue['edit']
 871        if not ('mask' in kwargs):      kwargs['mask'] =         defaultValue['mask']
 872
 873
 874        # results image
 875        res = copy.deepcopy(img)
 876
 877        # computing
 878        if kwargs != defaultValue:
 879            colorRGB = None
 880            if res.colorSpace.name == 'Lch':
 881                colorLCH = res.colorData
 882            elif res.colorSpace.name == 'sRGB':
 883
 884                covnStart = timer()
 885                if res.linear: 
 886
 887                    colorLab = sRGB_to_Lab(res.colorData, apply_cctf_decoding=False)
 888                    colorLCH = colour.Lab_to_LCHab(colorLab)
 889
 890                else:
 891
 892                    colorLab = sRGB_to_Lab(res.colorData, apply_cctf_decoding=True)
 893                    colorLCH = colour.Lab_to_LCHab(colorLab)
 894                covnEnd = timer()
 895
 896            # selection from colorLCH
 897            colorDataHue =          copy.deepcopy(colorLCH[:,:,2])
 898            colorDataChroma =       copy.deepcopy(colorLCH[:,:,1])
 899            colorDataLightness =    copy.deepcopy(colorLCH[:,:,0])
 900
 901            # selection mask
 902            hMin, hMax = kwargs['selection']['hue'] if 'hue' in kwargs['selection'].keys() else defaultValue['selection']['hue']
 903            cMin, cMax = kwargs['selection']['chroma'] if 'chroma' in kwargs['selection'].keys() else defaultValue['selection']['chroma']
 904            lMin, lMax = kwargs['selection']['lightness']if 'hue' in kwargs['selection'].keys() else defaultValue['selection']['lightness']
 905            # take into account Chroma, Lightness range
 906            cMax = cMax*max(100.0,np.amax(colorDataChroma))/100.0
 907            lMax = lMax*max(100.0,np.amax(colorDataLightness))/100.0
 908
 909            # tolerance
 910            hueTolerance = kwargs['tolerance']*360      # hue range ~ 360
 911            chromaTolerance = kwargs['tolerance']*100   # chroma range ~ 100
 912            lightTolerance = kwargs['tolerance']*100    # lightness range ~ 100
 913
 914
 915            maskStart = timer()
 916
 917            lightnessMask =     utils.NPlinearWeightMask(colorDataLightness, lMin, lMax, lightTolerance)
 918            chromaMask =        utils.NPlinearWeightMask(colorDataChroma, cMin, cMax, chromaTolerance)
 919            hueMask =           utils.NPlinearWeightMask(colorDataHue, hMin, hMax, hueTolerance)
 920
 921            maskEnd = timer()
 922
 923            mask = np.minimum(lightnessMask, np.minimum(chromaMask,hueMask))
 924            compMask = 1.0 - mask
 925            # hueShift (in Lch)
 926            hueShift =  kwargs['edit']['hue']  if 'hue' in kwargs['edit'].keys() else defaultValue['edit']['hue']
 927            if hueShift != 0.0:
 928                colorLCH[:,:,2] = ((colorLCH[:,:,2]+hueShift)%360)*mask + colorLCH[:,:,2]*compMask
 929
 930            # saturation (in Lch)
 931            saturation = kwargs['edit']['saturation'] if 'saturation' in kwargs['edit'].keys() else defaultValue['edit']['saturation']
 932            if saturation != 0 :
 933                gamma = 1/((saturation/25)+1) if saturation >= 0 else (-saturation/25)+1
 934                colorLCH[:,:,1] =np.power(colorLCH[:,:,1]/100, gamma)*100*mask + colorLCH[:,:,1]*compMask
 935
 936            # exposure (in RGB)
 937            ev =  kwargs['edit']['exposure'] if 'exposure' in kwargs['edit'].keys() else defaultValue['edit']['exposure']
 938            if ev != 0.0 :
 939                colorRGB = Lch_to_sRGB(colorLCH,apply_cctf_encoding=False, clip=False)
 940                colorRGBev = copy.deepcopy(colorRGB*math.pow(2,ev))
 941                colorRGBev[:,:,0] = colorRGBev[:,:,0]*mask
 942                colorRGBev[:,:,1] = colorRGBev[:,:,1]*mask
 943                colorRGBev[:,:,2] = colorRGBev[:,:,2]*mask
 944
 945                colorRGB[:,:,0] = colorRGB[:,:,0]*compMask
 946                colorRGB[:,:,1] = colorRGB[:,:,1]*compMask
 947                colorRGB[:,:,2] = colorRGB[:,:,2]*compMask
 948                colorRGB = colorRGB + colorRGBev
 949
 950            # contrast (in RGB prime)
 951            con =  kwargs['edit']['contrast'] if 'exposure' in kwargs['edit'].keys() else defaultValue['edit']['contrast']
 952            if con != 0 :
 953                con = con/100
 954                maxContrastFactor = 2.0
 955                if con>=0.0:
 956                    scalingFactor = 1*(1-con)+maxContrastFactor*con
 957                else:
 958                    con = -con
 959                    scalingFactor = 1*(1-con)+maxContrastFactor*con
 960                    scalingFactor = 1/scalingFactor
 961
 962                pivot = math.pow(2,ev)*(lMin+lMax)/2/100
 963
 964                if not isinstance(colorRGB, np.ndarray):    colorRGB = Lch_to_sRGB(colorLCH,apply_cctf_encoding=True, clip=False)
 965                else :                                      colorRGB = colour.cctf_encoding(colorRGB, function='sRGB')
 966                
 967                colorRGBcon = (colorRGB-pivot)*scalingFactor+pivot
 968
 969                colorRGB[:,:,0] = colorRGBcon[:,:,0]*mask+ colorRGB[:,:,0]*compMask
 970                colorRGB[:,:,1] = colorRGBcon[:,:,1]*mask+ colorRGB[:,:,1]*compMask
 971                colorRGB[:,:,2] = colorRGBcon[:,:,2]*mask+ colorRGB[:,:,2]*compMask
 972
 973                colorRGB = colour.cctf_decoding(colorRGB, function='sRGB')
 974
 975            # final step
 976            if not isinstance(colorRGB, np.ndarray): colorRGB = Lch_to_sRGB(colorLCH,apply_cctf_encoding=False, clip=False)
 977            res.colorData = colorRGB
 978            res.colorSpace = image.ColorSpace.build('sRGB')
 979            res.linear = True
 980
 981        else:
 982            if res.colorSpace.name == 'Lch':
 983                colorLCH = res.colorData
 984                # return to RGB (linear)
 985                colorRGB = Lch_to_sRGB(colorLCH,apply_cctf_encoding=False, clip=False)
 986                res.colorData = colorRGB
 987                res.colorSpace = image.ColorSpace.build('sRGB')
 988                res.linear = True
 989
 990        showMask = kwargs['mask']
 991        if showMask:
 992            res.colorData[:,:,0] = copy.deepcopy(mask)
 993            res.colorData[:,:,1] = copy.deepcopy(mask)
 994            res.colorData[:,:,2] = copy.deepcopy(mask)
 995
 996            res.colorSpace = image.ColorSpace.build('sRGB')
 997            res.linear = False
 998
 999        end = timer()
1000        if pref.verbose: print(" [PROCESS-PROFILING](",end - start,") >> colorEditor(",img.name,"):", kwargs)
1001
1002        return res

1049            colorDataY = sRGB_to_XYZ(res.colorData, apply_cctf_decoding=False)[:,:,1]
1050            mask = copy.deepcopy(res.colorData)
1051
1052            for key in rangeMask.keys():
1053                if kwargs[key]: # mask on
1054                    mask[(colorDataY >= rangeMask[key][0]/100)*(colorDataY<rangeMask[key][1]/100),:] = np.asarray(maskColor[key])
1055
1056            res.colorData = mask
1057        
1058        end = timer()
1059        if pref.verbose: print(" [PROCESS-PROFILING](",end - start,") >> lightnessMask(",res.name,"):", kwargs)
1060
1061        return res

1065class geometry(Processing):
1066    """
1067    Geometric transformation operation for HDR images.
1068
1069    This class implements basic geometric transformations for HDR images,
1070    including cropping and rotation. It allows modifying image dimensions
1071    and orientation while preserving HDR data precision.
1072
1073    Supported Transformations:
1074    - Cropping: Image dimension adjustment
1075    - Rotation: Image rotation by specified angle
1076    - Orientation: Image orientation management (up/down)
1077
1078    Parameters:
1079        ratio (tuple): Target aspect ratio (width, height)
1080        up (int): Image orientation (0: up, 1: down)
1081        rotation (float): Rotation angle in degrees
1082
1083    Notes:
1084        - Transformations are applied in order: rotation then cropping
1085        - Cropping preserves the specified aspect ratio
1086        - Rotation uses bilinear interpolation
1087        - HDR values are preserved during transformations
1088    """
1089    
1090    def compute(self, img, **kwargs): 
1091        """Geometric transformation operator.
1092
1093        Args:
1094            img (hdrCore.image.Image,Required): Input image
1095            kwargs (dict,Optional): Transformation parameters
1096                'ratio': (int,int) - Target aspect ratio (width, height)
1097                'up': int - Image orientation (0: up, 1: down)
1098                'rotation': float - Rotation angle in degrees
1099
1100                Default values = { 'ratio': (16,9), 'up': 0, 'rotation': 0.0}
1101                
1102        Returns:
1103            hdrCore.image.Image: Transformed image
1104
1105        Raises:
1106            ValueError: If transformation parameters are invalid
1107        """
1108        start = timer()
1109        defaultValue = { 'ratio': (16,9), 'up': 0,'rotation': 0.0}
1110        if not kwargs: kwargs = defaultValue  # default value 
1111        ratio =     kwargs['ratio']     if 'ratio' in kwargs.keys()     else defaultValue['ratio']
1112        up =        kwargs['up']        if 'up' in kwargs.keys()        else defaultValue['up']
1113        rotation =  kwargs['rotation']  if 'rotation' in kwargs.keys()  else defaultValue['rotation']
1114
1115        # results image
1116        res = copy.deepcopy(img)
1117
1118        ##if kwargs != defaultValue:
1119        h,w, c = res.colorData.shape
1120        imgRatio = w/h
1121
1122        if int(imgRatio*1000) != int(ratio[0]/ratio[1]*1000):
1123            if imgRatio < (ratio[0]/ratio[1]):
1124                hh16x9 = int(w*ratio[1]/ratio[0]/2)
1125                ch = h//2
1126                up = int((h//2-hh16x9)*up/100)
1127                res.colorData = res.colorData[(ch-hh16x9-up):(ch+hh16x9-up),:,:]
1128                res.shape = res.colorData.shape
1129            else:
1130                ww16x9 = int(h*ratio[0]/ratio[1]/2)
1131                ch = w//2
1132                res.colorData = res.colorData[:,(ch-ww16x9):(ch+ww16x9),:]
1133                res.shape = res.colorData.shape
1134
1135        if rotation != 0 :
1136            res.colorData = skimage.transform.rotate(res.colorData, rotation, clip = False, resize=False)
1137            h,w, _ = res.colorData.shape
1138            hh,ww = utils.croppRotated(h,w,rotation)
1139            res.colorData = res.colorData[int(h/2-hh/2):int(h/2+hh/2), int(w/2-ww/2):int(w/2+ww/2),:]
1140            res.shape = res.colorData.shape
1141
1142        end = timer()
1143        if pref.verbose: print(" [PROCESS-PROFILING] (",end-start,")>> geometry(",res.name,"):", kwargs)
1144
1145        return res

class ProcessPipe: 
1151class ProcessPipe(object):
1152    """
1153    Non-destructive HDR image processing pipeline.
1154
1155    This class implements an image processing pipeline that allows chaining
1156    operations in a non-destructive manner. It manages operation states,
1157    preserves the original image, and optimizes performance.
1158
1159    Architecture:
1160    The pipeline consists of processing nodes (ProcessNode) that encapsulate
1161    processing operations (Processing). Each node maintains its own state
1162    and parameters, enabling non-destructive editing.
1163
1164    Memory Management:
1165    - Original image is preserved
1166    - Intermediate images are computed on demand
1167    - Automatic resizing optimizes performance
1168    - Memory is efficiently managed for large images
1169
1170    Features:
1171    - Processing operation chaining
1172    - Operation state preservation
1173    - Optimized result computation
1174    - Metadata management
1175    - Result export
1176    - HDR preview
1177
1178    Attributes:
1179        - originalImage (hdrCore.image.Image): Original source image
1180        - __inputImage (hdrCore.image.Image): Current input image
1181        - __outputImage (hdrCore.image.Image): Current output image
1182        - processNodes ([ProcessNode]): List of processing nodes
1183        - previewHDR (bool): HDR preview state
1184        - previewHDR_process (): HDR preview process
1185
1186    Class Attributes:
1187        autoResize (bool): Enables automatic resizing
1188        maxSize (int): Maximum size for resizing
1189        maxWorking (int): Maximum size for processing
1190
1191    Usage:
1192        # Create a pipeline
1193        pipe = ProcessPipe()
1194        
1195        # Set source image
1196        pipe.setImage(source_image)
1197        
1198        # Add operations
1199        pipe.append(exposure(), {'value': 1.0})
1200        pipe.append(contrast(), {'value': 10})
1201        
1202        # Execute pipeline
1203        result = pipe.compute()
1204        
1205        # Export results
1206        pipe.export("output/", size=(1920, 1080))
1207
1208    Technical Notes:
1209        - Non-destructive pipeline
1210        - Automatic memory optimization
1211        - HDR processing support
1212        - Metadata management
1213        - Real-time preview
1214    """

1218    maxSize =       1200

1224    class ProcessNode(object):
1225        """
1226        Processing node encapsulating a processing operation.
1227
1228        This inner class encapsulates a processing operation (Processing)
1229        with its parameters and state. It manages conditional execution
1230        of operations and parameter persistence.
1231
1232        Attributes:
1233            - name (str): Processing node name
1234            - process (hdrCore.processing.Processing): Processing operation
1235            - params (dict): Current parameters
1236            - defaultParams (dict): Default parameters
1237            - requireUpdate (bool): Update required state
1238            - outputImage (hdrCore.image.Image): Output image
1239
1240        Notes:
1241            - Identifiant unique pour chaque nœud
1242            - Gestion d'état pour optimisation
1243            - Paramètres persistants
1244            - Support de l'exécution conditionnelle
1245        """
1246
1247        id = 0
1248
1249        def __init__(self,process,paramDict=None,name=None):
1250            """
1251            Initialize a new processing node.
1252
1253            Args:
1254                process (Processing): Processing operation to encapsulate
1255                paramDict (dict, optional): Initial parameters for the operation
1256                name (str, optional): Custom name for the node. If None, a default
1257                    name is generated using 'process_' prefix and a unique ID.
1258
1259            Notes:
1260                - Each node gets a unique ID for identification
1261                - Default parameters are stored for reset capability
1262                - Node state is initialized as requiring update
1263            """
1264            self.name = 'noname'
1265            if not name:
1266                self.name = 'process_'+str(ProcessNode.id)
1267                ProcessNode.id += 1
1268            else:
1269                self.name = name
1270            self.process = process
1271            self.params = paramDict
1272            self.defaultParams = copy.deepcopy(paramDict)
1273            self.requireUpdate = True # require a first process
1274            self.outputImage = None # store results image (Image)
1275
1276        def compute(self,img):
1277            """
1278            Execute the processing operation on the input image.
1279
1280            Args:
1281                img (hdrCore.image.Image): Input image to process
1282
1283            Notes:
1284                - Operation is executed only if update is required
1285                - Output image is cached for subsequent calls
1286                - Node state is updated after computation
1287            """
1288            self.outputImage = self.process.compute(img,**self.params)
1289            self.requireUpdate = False
1290
1291        def condCompute(self,img):
1292            """
1293            Conditionally execute the processing operation.
1294
1295            Args:
1296                img (hdrCore.image.Image): Input image to process
1297
1298            Notes:
1299                - Checks if parameters differ from defaults
1300                - Only executes if parameters have been modified
1301                - Preserves input image if no changes needed
1302            """
1303            if self.requireUpdate: self.compute(img)
1304            pass
1305
1306        def setParameters(self,paramDict):
1307            """
1308            Update the node's processing parameters.
1309
1310            Args:
1311                paramDict (dict): New parameter values to set
1312
1313            Notes:
1314                - Parameters are deep copied to prevent external modification
1315                - Node is marked for update after parameter change
1316                - Invalid parameters are ignored
1317            """
1318            if pref.verbose: print(" [PROCESS] >> ProcessNode.setParameters(",self.name,"):",paramDict)
1319            self.params=paramDict
1320            self.requireUpdate = True
1321
1322        def getParameters(self):
1323            """
1324            Retrieve the current processing parameters.
1325
1326            Returns:
1327                dict: Current parameter values
1328
1329            Notes:
1330                - Returns a copy of parameters to prevent external modification
1331                - Includes all parameters, even if unchanged from defaults
1332            """
1333            return self.params
1334
1335        def toDict(self):
1336            """
1337            Convert the node to a dictionary representation.
1338
1339            Returns:
1340                dict: Dictionary containing node name and parameters
1341
1342            Notes:
1343                - Used for serialization and state saving
1344                - Format: {node_name: parameters_dict}
1345                - Preserves parameter values for later restoration
1346            """
1347            return {self.name: self.params}

1509    def getImage(self,toneMap=True):
1510        """
1511        Get the current output image with optional tone mapping.
1512
1513        Args:
1514            toneMap (bool, optional): Whether to apply tone mapping (default: True)
1515
1516        Returns:
1517            hdrCore.image.Image: Processed output image, or None if no image is set
1518
1519        Notes:
1520            - Applies tone mapping if requested and image is HDR
1521            - Handles color space conversions automatically
1522            - Preserves original image data
1523            - Returns None if pipeline has no image
1524        """
1525        if isinstance(self.originalImage, image.Image): # if pipe has an image
1526            # conditionnal encoding or decoding to prime, linear
1527
1528            if (not self.originalImage.linear) and self.__outputImage.linear:
1529                self.__outputImage.colorData = colour.cctf_encoding(self.__outputImage.colorData, function='sRGB')
1530                self.__outputImage.linear =  False
1531
1532                if pref.verbose: print(" [PROCESS] >> ProcessPipe.getImage(",self.__outputImage.name,", toneMap:",toneMap,"): encode to sRGB !")
1533
1534            elif self.__outputImage.isHDR() and self.__outputImage.linear and toneMap:
1535                self.__outputImage.colorData = colour.cctf_encoding(self.__outputImage.colorData, function='sRGB')
1536                self.__outputImage.linear =  False
1537
1538                if pref.verbose: print(" [PROCESS] >> ProcessPipe.getImage(",self.__outputImage.name,", ,toneMap:",toneMap,"): tone map using cctf encoding !")
1539
1540            elif self.__outputImage.isHDR() and (not self.__outputImage.linear) and (not toneMap):
1541                self.__outputImage.colorData = colour.cctf_decoding(self.__outputImage.colorData, function='sRGB')
1542                self.__outputImage.linear =  True
1543
1544                if pref.verbose: print(" [PROCESS] >> ProcessPipe.getImage(",self.__outputImage.name,", toneMap:",toneMap,"): decoding to linear colorspace !")
1545
1546            elif (not self.__outputImage.linear) and (not toneMap):
1547                self.__outputImage.colorData = colour.cctf_decoding(self.__outputImage.colorData, function='sRGB')
1548                self.__outputImage.linear =  True
1549
1550                if pref.verbose: print(" [PROCESS] >> ProcessPipe.getImage(",self.__outputImage.name,", toneMap:",toneMap,"): decoding to linear colorspace !")
1551
1552            else:
1553                if pref.verbose: print(" [PROCESS] >> ProcessPipe.getImage(",self.__outputImage.name,", toneMap:",toneMap,"): just return output !")
1554
1555            return self.__outputImage
1556        else: return None

1558    def compute(self,progress=None):
1559        """
1560        Execute the processing pipeline.
1561
1562        Args:
1563            progress (object, optional): Progress tracking object with showMessage
1564                and repaint methods
1565
1566        Notes:
1567            - Executes operations in sequence
1568            - Updates progress if tracking object provided
1569            - Preserves original image
1570            - Handles operation dependencies
1571            - Updates output image after completion
1572        """
1573        if self.__inputImage:
1574
1575            if len(self.processNodes)>0: 
1576                # first node
1577                if progress:
1578                    progress.showMessage('computing: '+self.processNodes[0].name+' start!')
1579                    progress.repaint()
1580                self.processNodes[0].condCompute(self.__inputImage)
1581                if progress:
1582                    progress.showMessage('computing: '+self.processNodes[0].name+' done!')
1583                    progress.repaint()
1584                # other nodes
1585                for i,processNode in enumerate(self.processNodes[1:]):
1586                    if progress:
1587                        progress.showMessage('computing: '+processNode.name+' start!')
1588                        progress.repaint()
1589                    processNode.condCompute(self.processNodes[i].outputImage)
1590                    if progress:
1591                        progress.showMessage('computing: '+processNode.name+' done!')
1592                        progress.repaint()
1593            self.__outputImage=self.processNodes[-1].outputImage
1594

1597        Update parameters for a processing operation.
1598
1599        Args:
1600            id (int): Index of the operation to update
1601            paramDicts (dict): New parameter values
1602
1603        Notes:
1604            - Updates operation parameters
1605            - Marks dependent operations for update
1606            - Updates pipeline metadata
1607        """
1608        self.processNodes[id].setParameters(paramDicts)
1609        for processNode in self.processNodes[id:]: processNode.requireUpdate = True
1610        self.updateProcessPipeMetadata()

1628    def getProcessNodeByName(self,name):
1629        """

1631

1633            name (str): Name of the operation to find
1634

1636            int: Index of the operation, or -1 if not found
1637

1639            - Returns -1 if no operation matches the name
1640            - Names are case-sensitive

1659            - Shows update status for each operation

1662                "\t inputImage: "

1733        """
1734        Export the processed image to a file.
1735
1736        Args:
1737            dirName (str): Directory to save the exported image
1738            size (tuple, optional): Target size for export (width, height)
1739            to (dict, optional): Export settings including scaling and tags
1740            progress (object, optional): Progress tracking object
1741
1742        Returns:
1743            hdrCore.image.Image: Exported image
1744
1745        Notes:
1746            - Preserves original image and metadata
1747            - Applies resizing if specified
1748            - Handles HDR/SDR conversion
1749            - Updates metadata for export
1750            - Restores pipeline state after export
1751        """
1752        # recover input and processpipe metadata
1753        input = copy.deepcopy(self.originalImage)
1754        input.metadata.metadata['processpipe'] = self.toDict()
1755        input.metadata.save()
1756
1757        # load full size image
1758        img = image.Image.read(self.originalImage.path+'/'+self.originalImage.name)
1759        if size: img = img.process(resize(),size=(None, size[1]))
1760
1761        ProcessPipe.autoResize = False # set off autoresize
1762
1763        self.setImage(img)
1764
1765        self.compute(progress=progress)
1766        ###### res = hdrCore.coreC.coreCcompute(img, self)
1767
1768        res = self.getImage(toneMap=False)
1769        res = res.process(clip())
1770
1771        res.metadata = copy.deepcopy(img.metadata)                  # exif, hdr use case, ...
1772        res.metadata.metadata['processpipe'] = None                  # reset process pipe  
1773        
1774        ProcessPipe.autoResize = True# restore autoresize
1775        if to:
1776            res.colorData = res.colorData*to['scaling']
1777            res.metadata.metadata['display'] = to['tag']     # set display
1778
1779        if dirName:
1780            pathExport = os.path.join(dirName, img.name[:-4]+to['post']+'.hdr')
1781            res.write(pathExport)
1782
1783        #restore input
1784        self.setImage(input)
1785        self.compute()
1786
1787        return res

Non-destructive HDR image processing pipeline.

This class implements an image processing pipeline that allows chaining operations in a non-destructive manner. It manages operation states, preserves the original image, and optimizes performance.

Architecture: The pipeline consists of processing nodes (ProcessNode) that encapsulate processing operations (Processing). Each node maintains its own state and parameters, enabling non-destructive editing.

Memory Management:

  • Original image is preserved
  • Intermediate images are computed on demand
  • Automatic resizing optimizes performance
  • Memory is efficiently managed for large images

Features:

  • Processing operation chaining
  • Operation state preservation
  • Optimized result computation
  • Metadata management
  • Result export
  • HDR preview

Attributes: - originalImage (hdrCore.image.Image): Original source image - __inputImage (hdrCore.image.Image): Current input image - __outputImage (hdrCore.image.Image): Current output image - processNodes ([ProcessNode]): List of processing nodes - previewHDR (bool): HDR preview state - previewHDR_process (): HDR preview process

Class Attributes: autoResize (bool): Enables automatic resizing maxSize (int): Maximum size for resizing maxWorking (int): Maximum size for processing

Usage: # Create a pipeline pipe = ProcessPipe()

# Set source image
pipe.setImage(source_image)

# Add operations
pipe.append(exposure(), {'value': 1.0})
pipe.append(contrast(), {'value': 10})

# Execute pipeline
result = pipe.compute()

# Export results
pipe.export("output/", size=(1920, 1080))

Technical Notes: - Non-destructive pipeline - Automatic memory optimization - HDR processing support - Metadata management - Real-time preview

def append(self, process, paramDict=None, name=None): 
1380    def append(self,process,paramDict=None,name=None):
1381        """
1382        Add a processing operation to the pipeline.
1383
1384        Args:
1385            process (Processing): Processing operation to add
1386            paramDict (dict, optional): Initial parameters for the operation
1387            name (str, optional): Custom name for the operation node
1388
1389        Returns:
1390            int: Index of the newly added operation in the pipeline
1391
1392        Notes:
1393            - Operation is encapsulated in a ProcessNode
1394            - Parameters are optional and can be set later
1395            - Custom names help identify operations in the pipeline
1396        """

def getImage(self, toneMap=True): 
1509    def getImage(self,toneMap=True):
1510        """
1511        Get the current output image with optional tone mapping.
1512
1513        Args:
1514            toneMap (bool, optional): Whether to apply tone mapping (default: True)
1515
1516        Returns:
1517            hdrCore.image.Image: Processed output image, or None if no image is set
1518
1519        Notes:
1520            - Applies tone mapping if requested and image is HDR
1521            - Handles color space conversions automatically
1522            - Preserves original image data
1523            - Returns None if pipeline has no image
1524        """
1525        if isinstance(self.originalImage, image.Image): # if pipe has an image
1526            # conditionnal encoding or decoding to prime, linear
1527
1528            if (not self.originalImage.linear) and self.__outputImage.linear:
1529                self.__outputImage.colorData = colour.cctf_encoding(self.__outputImage.colorData, function='sRGB')
1530                self.__outputImage.linear =  False
1531
1532                if pref.verbose: print(" [PROCESS] >> ProcessPipe.getImage(",self.__outputImage.name,", toneMap:",toneMap,"): encode to sRGB !")
1533
1534            elif self.__outputImage.isHDR() and self.__outputImage.linear and toneMap:
1535                self.__outputImage.colorData = colour.cctf_encoding(self.__outputImage.colorData, function='sRGB')
1536                self.__outputImage.linear =  False
1537
1538                if pref.verbose: print(" [PROCESS] >> ProcessPipe.getImage(",self.__outputImage.name,", ,toneMap:",toneMap,"): tone map using cctf encoding !")
1539
1540            elif self.__outputImage.isHDR() and (not self.__outputImage.linear) and (not toneMap):
1541                self.__outputImage.colorData = colour.cctf_decoding(self.__outputImage.colorData, function='sRGB')
1542                self.__outputImage.linear =  True
1543
1544                if pref.verbose: print(" [PROCESS] >> ProcessPipe.getImage(",self.__outputImage.name,", toneMap:",toneMap,"): decoding to linear colorspace !")
1545
1546            elif (not self.__outputImage.linear) and (not toneMap):
1547                self.__outputImage.colorData = colour.cctf_decoding(self.__outputImage.colorData, function='sRGB')
1548                self.__outputImage.linear =  True
1549
1550                if pref.verbose: print(" [PROCESS] >> ProcessPipe.getImage(",self.__outputImage.name,", toneMap:",toneMap,"): decoding to linear colorspace !")
1551
1552            else:
1553                if pref.verbose: print(" [PROCESS] >> ProcessPipe.getImage(",self.__outputImage.name,", toneMap:",toneMap,"): just return output !")
1554
1555            return self.__outputImage
1556        else: return None

def compute(self, progress=None): 
1558    def compute(self,progress=None):
1559        """
1560        Execute the processing pipeline.
1561
1562        Args:
1563            progress (object, optional): Progress tracking object with showMessage
1564                and repaint methods
1565
1566        Notes:
1567            - Executes operations in sequence
1568            - Updates progress if tracking object provided
1569            - Preserves original image
1570            - Handles operation dependencies
1571            - Updates output image after completion
1572        """
1573        if self.__inputImage:
1574
1575            if len(self.processNodes)>0: 
1576                # first node
1577                if progress:
1578                    progress.showMessage('computing: '+self.processNodes[0].name+' start!')
1579                    progress.repaint()
1580                self.processNodes[0].condCompute(self.__inputImage)
1581                if progress:
1582                    progress.showMessage('computing: '+self.processNodes[0].name+' done!')
1583                    progress.repaint()
1584                # other nodes
1585                for i,processNode in enumerate(self.processNodes[1:]):
1586                    if progress:
1587                        progress.showMessage('computing: '+processNode.name+' start!')
1588                        progress.repaint()
1589                    processNode.condCompute(self.processNodes[i].outputImage)
1590                    if progress:
1591                        progress.showMessage('computing: '+processNode.name+' done!')
1592                        progress.repaint()
1593            self.__outputImage=self.processNodes[-1].outputImage

1768        res = self.getImage(toneMap=False)
1769        res = res.process(clip())
1770
1771        res.metadata = copy.deepcopy(img.metadata)                  # exif, hdr use case, ...
1772        res.metadata.metadata['processpipe'] = None                  # reset process pipe  
1773        
1774        ProcessPipe.autoResize = True# restore autoresize
1775        if to:
1776            res.colorData = res.colorData*to['scaling']
1777            res.metadata.metadata['display'] = to['tag']     # set display
1778
1779        if dirName:
1780            pathExport = os.path.join(dirName, img.name[:-4]+to['post']+'.hdr')
1781            res.write(pathExport)
1782
1783        #restore input
1784        self.setImage(input)
1785        self.compute()
1786
1787        return res

Export the processed image to a file.

Args: dirName (str): Directory to save the exported image size (tuple, optional): Target size for export (width, height) to (dict, optional): Export settings including scaling and tags progress (object, optional): Progress tracking object

Returns: hdrCore.image.Image: Exported image

Notes: - Preserves original image and metadata - Applies resizing if specified - Handles HDR/SDR conversion - Updates metadata for export - Restores pipeline state after export

class ProcessPipe.ProcessNode: 
1224    class ProcessNode(object):
1225        """
1226        Processing node encapsulating a processing operation.
1227
1228        This inner class encapsulates a processing operation (Processing)
1229        with its parameters and state. It manages conditional execution
1230        of operations and parameter persistence.
1231
1232        Attributes:
1233            - name (str): Processing node name
1234            - process (hdrCore.processing.Processing): Processing operation
1235            - params (dict): Current parameters
1236            - defaultParams (dict): Default parameters
1237            - requireUpdate (bool): Update required state
1238            - outputImage (hdrCore.image.Image): Output image
1239
1240        Notes:
1241            - Identifiant unique pour chaque nœud
1242            - Gestion d'état pour optimisation
1243            - Paramètres persistants
1244            - Support de l'exécution conditionnelle
1245        """
1246
1247        id = 0
1248
1249        def __init__(self,process,paramDict=None,name=None):
1250            """
1251            Initialize a new processing node.
1252
1253            Args:
1254                process (Processing): Processing operation to encapsulate
1255                paramDict (dict, optional): Initial parameters for the operation
1256                name (str, optional): Custom name for the node. If None, a default
1257                    name is generated using 'process_' prefix and a unique ID.
1258
1259            Notes:
1260                - Each node gets a unique ID for identification
1261                - Default parameters are stored for reset capability
1262                - Node state is initialized as requiring update
1263            """
1264            self.name = 'noname'
1265            if not name:
1266                self.name = 'process_'+str(ProcessNode.id)
1267                ProcessNode.id += 1
1268            else:
1269                self.name = name
1270            self.process = process
1271            self.params = paramDict
1272            self.defaultParams = copy.deepcopy(paramDict)
1273            self.requireUpdate = True # require a first process
1274            self.outputImage = None # store results image (Image)
1275
1276        def compute(self,img):
1277            """
1278            Execute the processing operation on the input image.
1279
1280            Args:
1281                img (hdrCore.image.Image): Input image to process
1282
1283            Notes:
1284                - Operation is executed only if update is required
1285                - Output image is cached for subsequent calls
1286                - Node state is updated after computation
1287            """
1288            self.outputImage = self.process.compute(img,**self.params)
1289            self.requireUpdate = False
1290
1291        def condCompute(self,img):
1292            """
1293            Conditionally execute the processing operation.
1294
1295            Args:
1296                img (hdrCore.image.Image): Input image to process
1297
1298            Notes:
1299                - Checks if parameters differ from defaults
1300                - Only executes if parameters have been modified
1301                - Preserves input image if no changes needed
1302            """
1303            if self.requireUpdate: self.compute(img)
1304            pass
1305
1306        def setParameters(self,paramDict):
1307            """
1308            Update the node's processing parameters.
1309
1310            Args:
1311                paramDict (dict): New parameter values to set
1312
1313            Notes:
1314                - Parameters are deep copied to prevent external modification
1315                - Node is marked for update after parameter change
1316                - Invalid parameters are ignored
1317            """
1318            if pref.verbose: print(" [PROCESS] >> ProcessNode.setParameters(",self.name,"):",paramDict)
1319            self.params=paramDict
1320            self.requireUpdate = True
1321
1322        def getParameters(self):
1323            """
1324            Retrieve the current processing parameters.
1325
1326            Returns:
1327                dict: Current parameter values
1328
1329            Notes:
1330                - Returns a copy of parameters to prevent external modification
1331                - Includes all parameters, even if unchanged from defaults
1332            """
1333            return self.params
1334
1335        def toDict(self):
1336            """
1337            Convert the node to a dictionary representation.
1338
1339            Returns:
1340                dict: Dictionary containing node name and parameters
1341
1342            Notes:
1343                - Used for serialization and state saving
1344                - Format: {node_name: parameters_dict}
1345                - Preserves parameter values for later restoration
1346            """
1347            return {self.name: self.params}
